dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmarked cop CAR GUNS through traffic, cherry top flashing. Slides through a turn. SCREECHES to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTIN RIGGS driving, ROGER MURTAUGH riding shotgun. Both stunned at what they're seeing.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. A dozen different fires light the street. In the center of it all, two blocks away, walking away from them, squirting a flamethrower with one hand and FIRING an AK-47 with the other, a human tank wearing level-3, full-body armor, facemask, etc. He napalms another car.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What're we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Run him over. Riggs FLOORS it at the guy.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What if he turns and shoots us with that friggin assault rifle?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Maybe he won't. He hasn't yet.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Right. But what if he does?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Try being positive for once, Rog. We're cops.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Unlike you, my life matters to me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You got another way to stop him? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. No. Okay, you're right, we're cops... I hope he doesn't turn.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Then do be a Do-bee, don't be a Don't-bee. Will him not to turn.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Will him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Will him. Yeah. C'mon... (chants ) --- Don't turn, don't turn... C'mon, Rog, will him with me...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (beat; what the hell) Don't turn, don't turn...

dialogues.speaker: TOGETHER
dialogues.text: --- Don't turn, don't turn...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He's turning.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR SKIDS sideways as Riggs throws the wheel over. The human TANK OPENS UP on them. BULLETS SHRED the vehicle. Riggs and Murtaugh bail out and take cover behind the wheels. There's fire all around them.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Had to turn so my side faced him?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: There's no right turn here. The shooting stops. Riggs and Murtaugh pop up FIRING. SLUGS BOUNCE off the guy's body armor. They drop back.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We're in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's your fault, Rog. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: My fault? How's it my fault? I said the words.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You said 'em. But I know you didn't believe ‘em. Murtaugh rolls his eyes. Peeks. The human tank's walking toward them. MORE BULLETS. He torches a kiosk.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll draw his fire. You run for cover.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No, no, no. I'1l draw the fire, and you run for cover.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I got less to lose, so you do the running.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You're younger, in love --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: And you got a wife and kids. Are you nuts, Rog? I got lots less to lose. I'm going first.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Get ready to run, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... I'm not supposed to tell you this, but... Lorna's pregnant. You're gonna be a father. Riggs wasn't expecting that one.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: She's afraid to tell you. You never discussed having children.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: +. That kid with the crayon...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What kid? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He draws stuff and it comes to life... Draws the moon so he can walk in the moonlight... Purple crayon... Don't remember his name... Just popped into my head when you... A baby...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, a baby. And I'm older, and I've been a dad, so I'm going first.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (then) You can't go first, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: ‘Cause there's something I'm not supposed to tell you, too... Rianne's pregnant. You're gonna be a grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Rianne can't be pregnant. She's not married... Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It was an accident. She and the guy aren't serious... She was gonna tell you this weekend when you were nice and relaxed. Riggs peeks at the human tank, now standing a short distance away with his gun leveled. Riggs ducks back as BULLETS RAKE the car again. Murtaugh looks sick.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Not sure I want to live now.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The kid needs a grandad, Rog... Take off your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Strip, Rog. Fast. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What the hell for?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You run. He turns. Seeing you in your undies distracts him -- it'd distract me -- and that's when I shoot.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Shoot what?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The one place he's vulnerable --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You mean gonna shoot him in the --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No, not there. The valve of that napalm tank.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You're gonna hit a little bitty valve before he shoots me?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: -.-. Trust me, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Trust you? Beat. Murtaugh starts stripping.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I gotta be crazy.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: A second ago, you didn't care if you lived.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: That was before the prospect of ending up dead in my underwear.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Just hurry, Rog. It's getting a little warm here.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ++. Is he black?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Can't tell with all that armor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Not him. The father of the baby. He's black, right?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Please let him be black. Not the blond kid with pits in his face. .+. Bad enough she did that condom commercial. She could've at least used 'em

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (finishes undressing) I don't wanna die in my underwear. Riggs looks. Murtaugh's wearing pink satin boxers.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Are those pink --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Not now. Just hit the damn tank. Riggs drops it. They get set to move.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Also, flap your arms and make noises like a bird.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It'll distract him more. I need him to turn. Ready? On two.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: On two? We always go on three.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Change of pace, okay? One, two -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh bolts from behind the car, flapping his arms and making noises like Riggs told him. The guy turns... and the sight does make him pause. Just long enough for Riggs to stand and SHOOT. Riggs' slug tears off the stem of the flamethrower tank, releasing napalm in a high-pressure, burning jet that rockets the human tank off the ground and through the air toward a nearby gas station. He impacts a gas pump. Fuel ignites. The STATION EXPLODES. A tanker TRUCK offloading gas is BLOWN upward OUT OF FRAME. Riggs and Murtaugh watch the inferno. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I'm too young to be a grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What about me? I'm gonna be someone's dad.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. Think that bird thing really helped?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Nah, I just wanted to see if you'd do it. Something catches their eye. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS /MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! They start running. A moment later, the tanker drops from the sky behind them. A few tons of metal falling at 9.81 meters/second/second. Right onto their car... Riggs and Murtaugh get to safety. Look back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Never a dull moment, huh, Rog?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Not since I met you. AD LIBS: 1) Wasn't that a gas? 2) That's oil, folks. MAIN TITLES.  10 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A detail of Red Chinese soldiers waits outside the gates.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: The gates open. More PRC soldiers escort out four Chinese men wearing prisoners' shock belts. The oldest of the four is in his 70s, dignified. The youngest is 50ish and menacing, eye like a pit viper... They're led toward a vehicle in a waiting convoy. A young PRC soldier touches the older man's arm to help him in. Ina flash, the pit viper strikes the soldier dead for the offense. Executes a gravity-defying flying double kick that snaps the soldier's neck. Another soldier quickly jabs a button on a remote control unit. 50,000 volts from the shock belts jolt the prisoner's bodies. Three of them drop instantly to the ground in agony... Not the pit viper... Incredibly, he stays on his feet. Teeth gritted. Muscles quivering from the punishing electric current. Staring back at his tormenter. A full ten seconds... The soldier releases the button. The flow of electricity stops... As the pit viper moves to help the old man up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four prisoners and the PRC Army guard detail board a large, commercial-type jet. The door's shut and sealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a navigation plotter. Destination: L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet takes off into the dark sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh's boat bobs on the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 12-foot, live shark thrashes madly inside the cockpit, jaws snapping. REVEAL Riggs, Murtaugh, and LEO GETZ looking down at it from the tuna tower. Clearly, they've scrambled there to escape the furious beast. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: That shark damages my new boat, I'm taking it outta you, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Then why do you want to keep it?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, what the hell you want a a shark for?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: The teeth'1l look good on a wall.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: They gotta stop snapping first.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: «+. Maybe it'll go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Go have a conversation with it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Doesn't look tired to me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Eating Leo might wear it out.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Ha-ha.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: It's a thought.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Fun-ny.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Do sharks eat their own kind?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Stop, I'm in stitches. Riggs and Murtaugh move to grab Leo. Leo moves away.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... It's my fish, I'll take care of it. Leo moves off, down a hatch into the cabin. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The shark 10.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Why'd we bring Leo along, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: He said you invited him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He told me you did. thrashes some more.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: ...-Last guy trip before the baby's here.... It's all about to change, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Easy on the boat, shark! Leo pops his head out of the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Where's my bag?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Starboard side aft.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Starboard. That's left.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Port's left. Starboard's right.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: 'Right,' yeah. Right side aft. Leo disappears again. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs... I've kept my nose out of it, but you and Lorna... you're having a baby... you're living together... you're not getting married...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: That violate your family values, Rog?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Just trying to understand -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I mean, Rianne's not exactly married either, is she?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... That's below the belt.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. You're right. I'm sorry... I was married once before, Rog. She's dead 'cause I'm a cop.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: That was a terrible thing. But Lorna's a cop, too. I don't see the problem.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The problem... The problem is, maybe I don't wear the wedding ring anymore, Rog, but I look down, and it's still there. The two men share a long look. Leo pops up again.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You did say aft.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: A-f-t. Aft.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: And that's a fucking word?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Back of the cabin, right side.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: So why not just say that?... People get around water, they gotta talk all that nautical shit. Leo disappears again. Murtaugh turns back to Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What's Lorna say about this?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We haven't talked about it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: A few days 'til the baby's due, and you haven't talked about marriage at_all? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Do we want Leo to shoot the shark?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Do we want Leo to shoot the shark? REVEAL Leo's about to shoot the shark with a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No, Leo! Murtaugh jumps, wrests the gun from him.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Jeez. What's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You're shooting a gun in my boat!

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I was just gonna kill Jaws there.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Nobody's killing it. I'm not letting a good animal die just so you can have its teeth, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You're crankier since finding out you're gonna be a grandpa. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (re: gun) This isn't mine or Rog's.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I got my P.I. license now, right?... A gumshoe sometimes finds himself in ugly situations.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You're an ugly situation, period.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's illegal to carry a weapon without a permit. Riggs tosses the gun in the sea. Blam! A GUNSHOT.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Was that Leo's gun? BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! From the other direction. They turn... and there's the bow of a two-hundred-foot freighter about to run them down. Leo screams. Murtaugh leaps to the helm. Jams the throttle ahead full. The boat jumps forward... and the freighter rushes by, inches away, snagging fishing lines, pulling poles from sockets. And then it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: My boat... Thank God...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The gunfire came from the ship. Let's go, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: After it. Someone could be in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. I'll radio the Coast Guard.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Fine. And we'll go after it. Riggs moves to the helm, jams down the THROTTLE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hey! Careful! (takes the helm) I'll drive. You hurt things. I don't want my new boat hurt. (snags the VHS) Coast Guard, 'Code 7,' Coast Guard, 'Code 7,' over.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Leo, get our guns and badges. Leo goes. Over the RADIO, we hear --

dialogues.speaker: COAST GUARDSMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "Code 7,' this is Coast Guard Group L.A. Long Beach, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Coast Guard, 'Code 7.' This is Sgt. Murtaugh, L.A.P.D. Want to report gun shots aboard a freighter headed due north approximately one mile from L.A. Harbor. Over.

dialogues.speaker: COAST GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ‘Code 7,' what is the name of the vessel? Over.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (Name). Outta Hong Kong. Over.

dialogues.speaker: COAST GUARDSMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger, 'Code 7.' Wait one. Leo reappears with badges and guns. Re: Riggs' pistol!--

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: New Beretta?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Testing a laser sight for the department. He aims at Leo. A red laser dot appears on Leo's nose.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Got a mole you want removed?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Hey, don't fuck with that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COAST GUARDSMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "Code 7,' Coast Guard. We have a cutter en route, over.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Coast Guard, 'Code 7.' Copy. ‘Code 7' out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then, to Riggs, as they pull in behind the ship --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We'll just hang here safe and outta sight 'til the Coast Guard arrives. Whereupon a searchlight on the ship suddenly illuminates them. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... Show 'em our badges? They hold up badges. Multiple WEAPONS OPEN UP on them. Murtaugh throws the helm over as Riggs FIRES BACK. Nails the searchlight. Keeps FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: FREIGHTER 14
dialogues.text: One of the shooters takes a bullet. Knocks over the searchlight as he goes down FIRING. SLUGS PUNCTURE a stack of kerosene drums lashed topside. Leaking fuel reaches the broken searchlight, still sparking on the deck. The FUEL IGNITES. The DRUMS EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese captain looks back as another fuel DRUM EXPLODES. The stern's engulfed in flame. He yells to the crew (italics indicate Chinese) --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Abandon ship! As people leave their positions to abandon ship --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH'S BOAT 16
dialogues.text: A short distance away. Watching the fireworks on the freighter. No one's shooting at them now. They see a lifeboat lower from the freighter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: They're trying to get away. Let's get over there, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Coast Guard'll be here any minute.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: And those guys'1ll be gone. Beat. Murtaugh relents, steers for the ship.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: They better not shoot up my boat. Leo peeks out from somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Helluva fucking fishing trip.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Shut up and keep your head down. Murtaugh pulls up alongside the lifeboat as it hits the water, still tethered to the ship. Riggs jumps aboard the bouncing craft, surprising two crewmen within.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Ahoy. They move to shoot Riggs. Riggs NAILS both. But a bullet parts one end of the line Riggs is holding -- a line rigged up to the ship -- and suddenly, Riggs is SHOOTING up into the air. Ina flash, he's hauled to the davits, drops to --  17 18 19 20 21 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the midst of other heavily-armed crewmen.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You're under arrest. Someone OPENS UP on him, and the GUNFIGHT's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The untended wheel turns slowly... pointing the ship toward the not-so-distant lights of L.A.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH'S BOAT 19
dialogues.text: Murtaugh watches the freighter turn.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: It's heading for the beach.

dialogues.speaker: FREIGHTER 20
dialogues.text: The ship approaches the shore. Riggs ends one GUNFIGHT and gets into another, finally engaging a gunman at the very tip of the ship's bow. The gunman's behind a large winch, pins Riggs down with an automatic weapon. Riggs can't hit him and can't run... when he sees the ship's metal gunwale converging behind the gunman. Quickly eyeballs the angles involved. Aims the laser down the gunwale. FIRES. Banks a slug off the steel. Takes out the gunman with a ricochet... whereupon the ship runs aground. The abrupt stop topples cranes, everything not fastened down, and tosses Riggs hard against a winch, knocking his gun away... Remaining crew throw lines over to jump ship. Riggs shakes off the blow from the winch. Catches the ship's Captain heading for the side. The Captain whips a kung fu move on him. kK.O.s Riggs... The Captain moves toward a rope. Two crewmen are in line to go down. The Captain's not in a waiting mood. Pulls a GUN, SHOOTS them both off the ship. Grabs the rope and slides down.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH'S BOAT 21
dialogues.text: Murtaugh's followed the freighter in, stays just beyond the surf line near the beached ship.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Holy shit. That was great. Wasn't that great? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 CONTINUED: (Al)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hope Riggs is okay. Leo regards the shark, now motionless in the cockpit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I think the shark's asleep now. BOOM! Another EXPLOSION up on the ship's deck. Murtaugh looks up to see a burning OIL DRUM blown high into the air. He follows the drum's trajectory.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Oh, shit... Jump, Leo. Murtaugh shoves Leo off the boat... just as the heavy, fiery drum crushes it. The boat instantly begins sinking. Murtaugh bobs near Leo, looking on.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: My boat... As the boat goes down, water begins to cover the shark and... revives it.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I think the shark's awake again.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Murtaugh and Leo begin stroking madly as the shark swims free of the wreckage. Leo urges himself on.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Swim, swim, swim... Murtaugh sees the lifeboat, still tied to the freighter, drifting behind it. He swims over and climbs aboard. Then calls to Leo, paddling frantically nearby --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Leo, this way! Over here! Leo sees Murtaugh, alters course for the boat. He glances back. The shark's coming for him.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Agh! Swim! Swim! Swim! The shark closes quickly on the little guy. It's about to nail him... when Murtaugh grabs Leo's shirt, hauls him into the lifeboat. They tumble onto the floorboards.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You see that? Fucking shark almost ate me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What you get for trying to take his teeth. Murtaugh stands, watches his boat sink from sight. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Since meeting Riggs, I've had my house destroyed, my car wrecked, and my boat sunk... What's left?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: That's pretty much it. Murtaugh sees a "Code 7" life ring floating next to the lifeboat. He picks it up. All that's left of his boat.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON FREIGHTER 22
dialogues.text: Riggs is slowly coming around from the karate chop. Finds his gun. Stands. There's a CREAK behind him. Riggs spins. A hatch is opening. Riggs aims. The laser pinpoints an old Chinese woman emerging. Behind her are more Chinese. Other hatches open. Riggs lowers his gun, watches, stunned, as seemingly endless numbers of ragged, tired, and frightened Chinese men, women, and children slowly emerge onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coast Guard, LAPD, LAFD, INS -- you name it, they're there, plus news crews and looky-loos. The Chinese have been corralled by INS near the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh and an INS AGENT look down at the Chinese herded together on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: Coast Guard interdicts about one of these a month.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Raggedy-looking folks.

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: Six weeks locked in a hold with one toilet. Rice and a little fish to eat... Lousy deal for thirty-five grand a head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Thirty-five grand? Where'd they get that kind of money?

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: Didn't. Gotta work it off. Snakeheads, the smugglers, they sell ‘em as cheap labor.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Sell ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: Like slaves. We see the word register with Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: Women and girls're forced into prostitution. Rest earn seventy cents an hour in the sweatshops.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: They gotta work off thirty-five G's making seventy cents an hour?

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: Takes years. Then the debt's gone, and the people're used up. From work, from drugs, from living two to a bed in some rat hole 'til they quit caring.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What about these people here?

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: They'11 claim asylum, say they were persecuted, like everybody else. We'll end up sending 'em back. Cost a goddamn fortune.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What happened to 'Bring me your tired, your poor, your wretched masses yearning to be free'?

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: Now it reads 'no vacancies’... You'd think word'd get back, and they'd give us a break, but they don't. Snakehead biz is booming. He indicates the shot-up corpse of a Chinese man nearby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: INS AGENT
dialogues.text: They pop one every boatload. Shows the rest what'll happen if they run off or don't pay. Murtaugh regards the body a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ‘Least he's no one's slave now. Beat. Riggs looks up, sees LEE BUTTERS approaching. Butters is a junior-grade detective, twenties, black.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: That kid's here -- what's his name !--

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: It's a food. Burgers? Bagels?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Breadsticks?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Biscuits?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Butters.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Right. Butters. Always kisses my ass. Gets me coffee 'n shit.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Probably looks up to you. You're a role model. An elder statesman.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: He wants to be like me, he shouldn't be kissing butt.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: (walks up) Sergeant Riggs, Sergeant Murtaugh -- what're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Long story.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: (to Murtaugh) You're all wet, sir. You need a blanket or something? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Before Murtaugh can say "no" --

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: I need a couple blankets here! Someone hands him blankets. He gives both to Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Here you go, sir.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (mot happy) Thanks, Burgers.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Butters.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Got a homicide over there. A troubled look crosses Butters' face.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Homicide?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You're a homicide detective.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: There's two more over the side. Butters crosses. Looks under the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! Riggs and Murtaugh don't understand the sudden reaction.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: He was shot!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Four times! At close range! Like he was executed!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: He was executed.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The crew did it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: That really pisses me off! Riggs and Murtaugh exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Folks're getting killed left, right, and center in this town! Now we're importing victims. Gang-bangers wanna cap each other, no problem! Shoot it out with the cops -- boom, you're dead, who cares? Some poor guy just trying to get through the shit 24-7-365, and he's whacked, that really pisses me off!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Easy, Biscuits.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: (beat; calmer) Just don't like it when people do bad things to good folks.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: ... Listen, Bagels, it's been a long night. We'll catch you tomorrow, okay?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. Be sure to dry off, Sergeant Murtaugh. Murtaugh just nods. He and Murtaugh head off.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Takes the job kinda personally.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Loud, too.

dialogues.speaker: ON BEACH
dialogues.text: Walking. Riggs groans from the karate chop.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Guy caught me with one. Fast. 25. 24 25 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Too fast for you? The question hangs there. Murtaugh suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Left something in the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'll get a patrol car to drop me at my truck. See you tomorrow... Sorry about your boat, Rog. I know it meant a lot. They share a look. Then Riggs heads off. Murtaugh goes to the beached lifeboat. Retrieves the "Code 7" life ring. In doing so, leans on the tarp covering the boat's forward half. A MUFFLED CRY. Beat. Murtaugh lifts the tarp, revealing ten Chinese -- men, women and children. Frightened stowaways, huddled together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE BENNY CHAN's seventies, wearing all Ralph Lauren Polo. Sitting with Benny, slightly apart, is WAH SING KU, thirty, discerning, full of dangerous potentials we can only guess at right now. Dressed in Shanghai Tang, modern clothes with classical Chinese touches, qualities Ku possesses. Both men, plus an Uncle Benny enforcer, YEE, have their attention focused on GEORGE PROODY, a young State Department suit holding up a sheaf of papers.

dialogues.speaker: PROODY
dialogues.text: Four sets of papers. Totally genuine. They'll get in the country, and they'll be able to stay. Forever. U.S. citizens. He hands the papers to Benny.

dialogues.speaker: PROODY
dialogues.text: Ask 'em to vote the incumbent party next election. Help me keep my job with the State Department.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: (eyeing reports) Bloody marvelous...

dialogues.speaker: PROODY
dialogues.text: They've red-flagged all Asian visas lately. Those weren't easy to slip through. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: (looks up; warmly) You've been a big help. We're very grateful. Another enforcer, CHU, enters with information. Looks at Ku, who indicates it's okay for him to speak. (In Chinese (subtitles).

dialogues.speaker: CHU
dialogues.text: «+. The ship went aground.

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: (controlled agitation) What about the merchandise?

dialogues.speaker: CHU
dialogues.text: It's missing.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: I'll find out about it immediately. The look Ku gives Benny is shaming, and Benny feels it.

dialogues.speaker: PROODY
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: (instant charm again) Small delivery problem... Thank you, Mr. Proody. Benny nods to Yee. Yee hands Proody a bundle of cash. Proody scans it. He's satisfied. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Good night. Proody is suddenly wary of his situation. Knows he's vulnerable now. Knows they're killers. With an eye on the room, he goes... After which Ku pulls a loop of Buddhist prayer beads from a pocket and fingers them, lost in dark meditation, while no one else speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proody moves to a parked car. Watchful. Hand ona pistol we now see he's had stuck in his waistband.  28 29 30 31 32 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in. Puts his key in the ignition. Hesitates. Is it gonna blow? Takes his chances. The CAR STARTS without incident. Proody peels out. Sighs. Smiles. He's alive and ten thousand bucks richer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to the L.A. River. Lights flash as the barricade lowers. In the distance, a train headlight. Proody's car pulls up and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train nearing. Proody dreaming about what he'll do with the bribe-money... when smash!... his CAR'S suddenly STRUCK hard from behind. Proody looks back. No headlights... Just the grill of a truck... He fumbles for the gun... Blinding light from the train fills the car. Proody can't react in time... The truck shoves him onto the tracks, in front of the speeding train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRAIN SLAMS into Proody's car. Launches. it. The twisted wreckage flips through the air toward the concret contained river. Drops onto the cement bank. EXPLODES as it rolls into the water... As hundred-dollar bills scatte in the wind, the back seat window of the truck rolls down revealing Ku. Ku regards the flaming wreck down the track amoment. Puts away his prayer beads. Rolls up the window... As the truck drives off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs pulls up in his truck. We see he's still aching from the karate chop as he moves to the front door. Eating French fries out of fast food sack.  33 34 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs unlocks the door, steps in, and... freezes mid- fry as a cocked pistol is put to his head. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Hi, honey. REVEAL LORNA COLE, nightie, nine millimeter, nine months pregnant. She lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: You were coming home last night.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Had some bad Chinese. As they continue, we see the place has been transformed. Additions, wings, decks, etc. open out from the old trail A woman's touch everywhere. Their two dogs and one cat greet Riggs and vice versa. Lorna sees how dirty and banged up he is.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Better than Roger. His boat sank. He feeds the dogs some fries.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Don't feed 'em that junk. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Gunfights, sharks, explosions... The usual.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: «+. You were out fishing. Does trouble just go looking for you?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No, it seems to know pretty much where I am most of the time. Riggs sees into a newly-added room.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You finished the nursery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs enters with Lorna, looks around. Baby to the max. Major puppy motif. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I figured it was good for a girl or a boy. Cute, huh?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Lotta puppies.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I know. I got on this puppy thing and just couldn't stop. (to her tummy) Hope you like doggies, baby. Beat. Riggs spins a mobile over the crib.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Lorna... We... We've never talked about... marriage. Lorna looks up at him. It could be a hopeful look.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I sorta figured you didn't want that... You want to get married?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Well... No.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Whew. Me, either. Want breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (that was easy; re: fast food) Got mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorna emerges, goes to the kitchen. Riggs follows her out. The DOGS are BARKING at the door.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You guys want to go out? C'mon. He opens the door, lets the dogs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs exits after the hounds. Sees a paperback romance on a chair and snags it. The author's "Ebony Clark." Riggs is reading a passage as Lorna emerges with cereal, milk, etc. Re the book -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You bought this smut?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: (looks over) It's not smut, it's Ebony Clark. Trish gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. Can we try this thing they do on page 22 sometime?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Not now. Nothing comes between a pregnant lady and a meal.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (beat; still reading) Have I ever made your ‘womanhood reach peaks that would rival the highest Himalayas'?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: The foothills of Malibu maybe. No Everests.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Just kidding. I've been to lots of mountaintops with you, Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Lorna are eating. Riggs keeps feeding the dogs surreptitiously.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I dropped by Internal Affairs yesterday. Y'know, to say hi.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: How's things with the rat squad?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: They miss me... The vet said not to feed 'em anything but dog food, Riggs. It's bad for 'em. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (to the dogs) Sorry, boys. You heard the boss.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: (beat) Overheard one thing at the office.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I.A.'s got an anonymous tip... The person said Roger's on the take.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Roger? That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Of course it is. It's someone with a grudge against him. Probably some jerk he put away... But with the new boats all the time and putting two kids through private college, it's caused conversation. Anyway, I thought you should know. I'1l tell you if it goes anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. Straight-arrow Rog on the take. That'd be the day.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Just don't tell him, okay? He'll blow his top, and I'll be in hot water. And he's got enough problems as it is anyway.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: «+. Oh... Oops...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's oops?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Pregnancy's destroyed my brain... It cannot leave here, Riggs. Under any circumstances. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Okay. What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: -+.» You know how Roger is about his daughters going out with cops.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He'd kill ‘em. Yeah? So?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: So Rianne's married to one. He's the father of her baby. She's too scared to tell Roger.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Back up... Rianne's married?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: To a cop. They met last year. They fell in love. She got pregnant. They got hitched.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: And no one's telling Rog.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: After the baby's born.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: ‘Here's the whole package, take it or leave it'?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I'm not saying it was a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's a good idea if you want to see Rog's head explode... What about Trish?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: She knows.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Who's the lucky soon-to-be-dead man?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: --.- Sgt. Lee Butters. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: .-. Biscuits?... This just gets better and better.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: No one thought he'd be transferred downtown with you guys.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No wonder he's been sucking up to Rog.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: You cannot tell him, Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You kidding? He'd shoot me for being the messenger... Question is how to have fun with it.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: This is serious. Don't screw around.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No. Right. No screwing around. I mean, Rog is my best friend. It'd be wrong to mess with him. But we know what that smile means...  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Lorna enter as Murtaugh comes down the stairs. Murtaugh's a little flustered, in a hurry to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Hey, Rog, we were just discussing baby names. You know which ones Rianne's thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (it hurts him) Oscar for a boy. Loreen for a girl.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. She couldn't come up with anything butter, I mean, better? Lorna surreptitiously jabs him.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I think they're nice.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Don't get me started. C'mon, let's go, Riggs. (to Lorna) Trish'll be right down. Have fun shopping for baby junk. Riggs glances into the living room -- on the floor are sleeping bags, etc. Murtaugh enters from the kitchen, a little flustered, in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Who had the sleep-over?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Uh, we're airing out the camping gear. We're outta here.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Something smells good.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Trish has food on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Trish is cooking something that smells good? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Some things do change. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: (to Riggs) Got your baby beeper?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (shows her) Right here... So long. As he kisses her goodbye, a small Chinese boy peeks out from the kitchen door. Makes eye contact with Riggs. And disappears. Murtaugh hasn't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Let's go, Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You know, that smells a lot like Chinese food.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: .». Yeah, Trish has been trying that lately. Who knew she could wok fry?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'd like to taste it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We don't have time -- But Riggs is already heading for the kitchen. Murtaugh hurries to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: C'mon, Rog, we're early. He starts to go. Murtaugh stops him again.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs... There's a Chinese person in the kitchen... A couple people, actually... Sort of a family... Riggs opens the kitchen door. REVEAL the Chinese people from the lifeboat inside cooking food.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: .+. A large family.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Lorna, and Murtaugh enter.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: They were hiding in the lifeboat... After what the I.N.S. guy said... Had to do something for ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: So you brought ‘em home.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Took two trips. The little boy's fascinated by Riggs. Stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: That's Ping. Murtaugh goes to a forty-ish MAN.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: This is Hong. He's head of the family. Speaks pretty good English... Hong, this is my partner, Martin Riggs. And this is Lorna.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Wife?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS /LORNA/MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: .«.. Rog, could we talk a moment? Riggs drags him out. Lorna eyes the Chinese food.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: That looks so good...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Those people're illegal.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You're breaking the law. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Not the way I see it. Way I see see it, I'm freeing slaves... Like no one did for my ancestors. NICK and CARRIE MURTAUGH enter. "Hi's" all around.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I see more of you two now then when you still lived here. Laundry, food... What is it this time?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Money.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Again? Both of you? What the hell you spending it on?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Drugs, hookers --

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Abortions --

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Contributions to 0.J.'s Defense Fund.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (to Riggs) You believe they talk to their father this way?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Dad, it costs a little more to be a college student than when you were going.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You think I don't know that? I get the tuition bills. Get the grades, too. And right now, I'm not getting much cluck for my buck... And when I was in school, I had a job. You know what that is?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Job? Uh-uh, do you know what a job is, Carrie?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Never heard of it. Is that j-o -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We can't work and survive U.S.C., Dad.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I got other things on my mind at the moment, so what I'm gonna do is give you the money now, and then fight with you about it later. Murtaugh reaches into his pocket, pulls out a large wad of cash. Riggs is surprised by the size of the roll. As Murtaugh doles it out to Nick and Carrie --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Consider this a down payment on a future ass-chewing.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Told you we should've asked Mom. They head out. Murtaugh calls after them --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I want to see some grades this term, too. Murtaugh puts away the wad.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Pretty big roll there, Rog... Anyway, back to the Chinese --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I've made up my mind about it. Beat. Riggs respects Murtaugh's commitment, but still... The PHONE RINGS. Murtaugh goes to answer it. Riggs heads back into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorna's now scarfing a big bowl of chow mein.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: This is just yummy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ping's still staring at Riggs. Riggs makes faces at him. Gets a big, gap-toothed grin in return. Murtaugh sticks his head in. Worried.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs. Captain wants us right away.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Didn't say... C'mon. Gotta go, Riggs. Riggs has a pair of chopsticks. Hands Ping an orange. Indicates for Ping to toss it in the air. Ping does... Riggs catches it with the chopsticks. Uses them to toss it back in the air. Changes his grip on the chopsticks. Spears the orange as it falls. Skewers it. Hands it back to Ping. Gets another big smile for it. He gives Lorna another peck, she mumbles goodbye, and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading for the door. Murtaugh's still worried.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Maybe someone saw me with the Hongs. Maybe the captain knows. TRISH MURTAUGH descends the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Lorna here?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Kitchen. On her second breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I remember those days. Two Chinese kids chase each other through.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Two more days to get them settled, Roger, and then they're gone... All of them. RIANNE MURTAUGH enters from outside. Nine months pregnant More "hello's." Then, to Rianne -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Looking great.

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Wait 'til she's trying to handle that baby all by herself.

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You know she'll be wanting to move back in, too. Be ol' grandpa Rog up giving the two A.M. feedings.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Better'n her being married to the wrong guy. Cop or something. Rianne glances anxiously at Trish.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. True... C'mon. OFF Riggs' innocent expression, as he and Murtaugh go -- EXT. MURTAUGH'S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER B4l Riggs and Murtaugh emerge. Murtaugh's worried.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What do you think the Captain wants us for?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I don't know. Running ships aground, shooting at people... That's a nice suit, by the way. That's not off the rack. Italian?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Gift from Trish. Riggs checks out the label. He's impressed.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Ar-money... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A44
dialogues.text: 44 42. CONTINUED: B4l

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Maybe somebody saw me with the Hongs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's possible. You made two trips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh enter. Murtaugh's eyes go to the bulletin board, on which we see posted a news photo and headline. The photo's of Murtaugh running in his satin undies, flapping his arms like a bird. The headline reads: "Bird Man Fowls Human Tank." He rips it down, yells to the squad room generally.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: It's been almost a year already. Shit's not funny anymore. He and Riggs head to Murphy's office. Behind Murtaugh's back, someone pins up another copy of the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh enter. CAPTAIN MURPHY'S there, staring out into the squad room.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: ++. I still look out there expecting to see all the old faces. Instead, there's a buncha kids whose names I barely remember.... We're dinosaurs. Headed for extinction. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Making way for the new, improved police force. Guys with guns and psychology degrees. Like Butters.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Butters has a psychology degree? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: More like a psycho degree.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I got nothing against it. Times gotta change... Hell, I got shot once by a hot-rodder with a zip- gun. That's how far back I go.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Uh, you wanted us for something,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: .»+. Yeah... Some things don't change... The department lost its insurance carrier. All the damage you do, they can't get a new one with you on the streets. Can't fire you, either. So they're promoting you.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: No open lieutenant spots. Chief's using his special privilege to make you captains. Riggs and Murtaugh look at each other in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We're all the same rank now?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Just 'til they get new insurance.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What the hell we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What captains do. Hang out by the coffee, take long lunches, yell stuff like 'Riggs, Murtaugh, get your asses in here! The chief's shitting bricks. You got any idea how much it costs to replace a fucking bowling alley?!'

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Just stay off the streets and outta trouble, huh? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (beat; a salute) Captain Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (salutes back) Captain Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (to Murphy) Captain.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (to Murtaugh) After you, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: After you, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: O Captain, my Captain --

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh emerge. As they approach their desks, the other DETECTIVES turn towards them.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Captains Outrageous... Everyone starts clapping.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Word travels fast.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Enjoy the rest from real police work. People return to work. An LAPD CHOPPER PILOT and OBSERVER walks over.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVER
dialogues.text: Now you're on the resource management side, come up in the helo sometime and see what crime fighting from the air's all about. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They go. 46. 45

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. No choppers. No way.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Rog is a down-to-earth kinda guy.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Change your mind, give us a call. Butters approaches. Murtaugh's leery of him.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Cap'n Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: There's fresh muffins in back. I can grab one for you.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I already ate.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Okay. Butters goes. Riggs was watching.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: That kid sure likes you, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Wish he'd quit that shit.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: -.. Maybe he really likes you.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Y'know, likes you likes you?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... What, you mean, like that?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Why not? You're a good-looking guy. Smart, funny...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Get outta here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Never know. It's the Nineties, Rog. You heard Murphy. Department's changing... But hey, you're probably right... 'Scuse me, Rog. Riggs goes. Just as Butters walks by again.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: That suit looks real good on you, by the way. Nice color. Murtaugh just watches him go... Across the room, Riggs catches up to WOODS, the PD shrink, walking through.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Dr. Woods.

dialogues.speaker: WOODS
dialogues.text: Yes? She turns. When she sees it's Riggs, her face falls.

dialogues.speaker: WOODS
dialogues.text: Oh... What is it, Captain Riggs?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (sotto) I... need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: WOODS
dialogues.text: I see... And what is it this time? More dreams about flying dwarves? In love with your gun again? Or have you cooked up something new?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: This is on the up and up... It's about... marriage.

dialogues.speaker: WOODS
dialogues.text: «+. And when we get in my office, you'll tell me you want to marry Murtaugh, or your mother, or Nelson Mandela...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Nelson Mandela?

dialogues.speaker: WOODS
dialogues.text: «+. Something to ridicule me, to get a rise out of me... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No, really...

dialogues.speaker: WOODS
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid. And my time's reserved for police officers in real need, with real problems. She turns and goes. Beat. Riggs calls after her --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I can't go out with you, I'm already in a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warehouse complex on the docks of the L.A. Harbor. Signs indicate the area's a U.S. Custom's-declared "Free Trade Zone." A car drives in the front gate, where it's met by uniformed Chinese security guards. Ku gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Chinese workers dismantling and crating large manufacturing machines. Security guards drive Ku through the warehouse on an electric cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ku's led in. We're in a temporary quarters of some kind. The occupants are the four men we saw escorted out of the Chinese prison. They're under guard. A PRC GENERAL meets Ku. In Chinese (subtitles) --

dialogues.speaker: PRC GENERAL
dialogues.text: Do you have the money?

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: Very soon... I came to see them. And bring this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ku pulls a small case from his pocket. Hands it to the General, who opens it. A pair of glasses. Beat. The General hands them back. Nods his approval... Ku crosses to the four men. Pays his respect to each of them, beginning with the oldest... Reaching the Pit Viper, Ku makes his deferences, and then --

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: Father. It's been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: PIT VIPER
dialogues.text: Soon it will be our time again. Ku turns, addresses them all. The concern we saw in his face earlier (in Benny Chan's restaurant) remains hidden.

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: Everything's progressing. It shouldn't be long now. Ku takes out the glasses, gives them to the oldest Four Father. As he does this, we see him also remove the lining to the case, and out of sight of the guards, pull out a bill of Chinese currency for the men to see... The bill's normal in all respects, except that where the portraits should be, there's only blank space... Having shown it to them, Ku then slides it back inside the lining of the case. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: America has many laws. Made by men. Money can change anything. Another beat. Then, as Ku bows to them and goes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FIND two sets of feet in adjoining stalls...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm bored being a Captain, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's only been a couple hours.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. And I'll go cuckoo sitting around all day. We gotta do something.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be hanging out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm hanging out. Water's cold, too.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. And deep.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Listen, you want to nail these snakeheads, right?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who-heads?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Snakeheads. Chinese smugglers. Slave traders.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I want to nail the sons of bitches.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... ‘Long as we stay outta trouble, I guess it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Great. Let's go... Oops, outta paper. Got change for a twenty?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here... As Murtaugh hands paper under the partition --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh approach DET. PAUL NG, at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: How's it going, Ng?

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh. Hear you were up to your asses in Chinese people last night. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The taller ones came up to our asses. Most of ‘em were down around... He indicates his knees.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: We're short, but there's lots of us. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Ship's crew shot one of the illegals. Apparently acted on orders. Asian Crimes know who's smuggling Chinese these days?

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: There's no hard evidence. We're pretty sure the big boss is a guy named Benny Chan.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Uncle Benny?

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Had some dealings with him. Back then he was moving smack.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Never nailed him on that, either.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Benny's slippery.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Where's he hanging out these days?

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: He's got a nightclub, couple restaurants he operates out of... Days it's a place on North Broadway. (writes) Here's the address. He hands it to Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ng. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: B46 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The guys start off.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Just let me know if you turn up anything. As Riggs and Murtaugh walk!--

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Sure love to pay Uncle Benny a visit, wouldn't you, Rog? For old times' sake?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah. But we're off the streets... It's Burgers' case. Better give the information to him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah... Hey, Breadsticks... Riggs waves him over. When he's there --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Ever hear of Benny Chan?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Big-time crime boss in Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: If it's bad, and it's Chinese, Benny's running it. Asian Crimes thinks he's behind the smuggling operation.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Where do I find him?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: His restaurant. But Riggs doesn't hand over the address he's holding.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. You know, I'm kinda hungry for Chinese. How about you, Rog? Before Murtaugh can answer -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Great... Since we're going there anyway, we'll drive you.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Whoa. Riggs --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We gotta eat, Rog. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, but --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: So we're carpooling. Saving the taxpayers' money. That's a Captain thing to do, right? Murtaugh pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Not with him...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Why?... Look, the kid could need backup, Rog. Somebody oughta be there. C'mon, grab your jacket. Beat. Murtaugh relents. Moves for his jacket. Catches Butters looking at him with a big smile. OFF which --
46 Driving. Riggs and Murtaugh up front. Butters in the back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: So, Butters... Seems like you hate crime in a sort of personal way.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I do.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Any particular reason?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: About a hundred fifty thousand of ‘em. That's how many bullets were zinging around my neighborhood growing up. Couldn't go outside half the time. Couldn't be near a window. Grew up on the floor. Slept on the floor, ate on the floor, watched T.V. on the floor. Hell, I didn't learn to walk 'til I was ten. Spent my formative years nose to nose with the family beagle... I'm working a crime, I'm thinking about that goddamn floor. And it pisses me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs sees something in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Did we tell Leo to meet us somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No, why?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: ‘Cause he's following us, five cars back. Murtaugh looks. There's Leo in his red Suburban.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Maybe it's a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: With Leo, nothing's a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Who's Leo? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He's... (searches ) What is he, Rog?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We had to guard him once, and we've been stuck with him ever since.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: What's he want?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Let's find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, we see the police sedan make a turn. Leo reaches the corner. Turns. No sign of the police car.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Where'd they go? He reaches a stop light. Cranes his neck to see both ways down the intersecting street. Nothing. They've disappeared. Leo's bummed. Glances out his side window... There's Riggs and Murtaugh in the lane right next to him, looking over from the police car.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Looking for us?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You saw me.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, we saw you. What're you doing, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Perfecting my tailing techniques. Being a P.I. and all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Private Eyesore.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: If I can follow L.A.'s finest without being spotted, I can follow anybody. (then, re: Butters) Who's the perp? What crime'd he commit?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Crime I'm gonna commit'1l be assault and battering your little P.I. ass. What, you see a black guy riding with two cops, you automatically assume he's a criminal?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He's a detective, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Oh... Hey, just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: So, the guys tell you about our history together? Fighting crime, shooting bad guys, maintaining law and order?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: "Bye, Leo. Riggs punches it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Shoulda let the shark eat him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking into the busy, second-floor restaurant through a window. In here, Uncle Benny's the object of Ku's wrath as Fan, Chu, and Yee look on. In Chinese (subtitles) --

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: You guaranteed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: They're not at the detention center. They must have escaped.

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: He won't finish until he sees them.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: They'll turn up. .. In Hong Kong, you'd already be dead. They're interrupted by a TAPPING sound. Turn to find Riggs, Murtaugh, and Butters looking in through the window into the restaurant. Riggs knocking on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On this side, the glass is a mirror. Riggs mimes various crap to Benny. Then he and Murtaugh start off. Butter is still checking his appearance out in the mirror. To himself -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: How you doing, Lee?... Just fine, thank you. Going to see Uncle Benny, the Chinese crime boss... Give him a kick in the nuts for me, won't you?... Be glad to... Murtaugh and Riggs exchange a look. Then --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: C'mon -- As Riggs pulls Butters away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh, and Butters enter via office door. MAITRE D' has failed to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Uncle Benny. Howya doing? Hope this is a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'd hate not disturbing you.

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE D'
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I couldn't stop them.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Meet Detective Buckles.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: (off that) Whatever you say.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Sell any heroin, buy any cops, kill anyone lately? How's the front, I mean, restaurant?

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE D'
dialogues.text: I get food, drink. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: No M.S.G. now. Have a bite. Give you the police discount. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Don't hold your breath. On second thought, hold your breath.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: (to Butters) They think I'ma criminal. Never have proof.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Yeah, these guys're always wrong. Never arrest the right people. I'm sure it's all a big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: «+. I'm very busy. What is it this time?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (prompting butters) Breadsticks...

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Know anything about a boatload of illegals that went aground last night?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: What I saw on the news. During this, Riggs grabs some papers from Benny's desk, and Benny snaps a ruler across Riggs' knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Some snakehead lost big money. Four hundred people at thirty- five grand each... Fourteen mil.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Lost out on making 'em slaves, too.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: You think they have it so nice in China? They'll be back. Anyway, you're cops. I thought smuggling Chinese was an I.N.S. problem.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Crew shot one of ‘em full of bullets. Makes it a cop problem. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: One dead Chinese? Billions more where he came from.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: They shot at Rog and me, too.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Too bad they missed. But I still don't know anything about it. Riggs has picked up on something out of the ordinary about Ku. Circles the room staring at him. ku staring back, fingering his prayer beads.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You don't look too happy. Who're you?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: He doesn't speak English.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Oh. So you don't know what ‘scumbag' means. Or ‘eat shit' «+. nice ponytail. Riggs reaches to flip Ku's "queue" with his fingers. Instantly, Ku grabs his wrist. Rigss is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Strong for a small guy... What else can you do? Ku just looks at him. Beat. We're sensing this'd be a good fight to watch. Butters makes a move to help Riggs. Murtaugh stops him. To Riggs --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs... Insurance... Another beat. Riggs lets go of Ku's clothes. Whereupon Ku releases him... Then --

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: I'm busy. If you have nothing on me, get out.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... Just know we're still around, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: I'm after your ass now, too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (to Ku) See you next time. Riggs moves toward the one-way glass.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: The door's that way.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'll take this way out. Whereupon Riggs smacks the one-way glass with the butt of his pistol. SHATTERS the GLASS. Steps out. Murtaugh and Butters follow. When they're gone, to Riggs, under his breath and in English --

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: In Hong Kong, you'd be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Riggs, Murtaugh, and Butters cross to the stairs, Riggs sees a panel marked "Sprinkler Emergency Switch" on a wall. Looks back at Benny.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Had your fire system checked lately? Big fine if it doesn't operate right. Whereupon he pulls the alarm handle. A SIREN begins WAILING. Sprinklers erupt. Diners shriek. Back in his office, Uncle Benny's getting soaked, too. A man moves to shield Ku with a jacket... Riggs calls in --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Seems to be working.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 53
dialogues.text: INT. RESTAURANT —- STAIRWELL A54 We hear the commotion upstairs as Riggs, Murtaugh, and Butters descend. Near the bottom of the stairs, out a window, Riggs sees the Captain of the freighter. The Captain's outside, approaching the restaurant with another Chinese man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Spots Riggs at the same instant. Starts to run --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. (drawing his gun) That guy's from the ship. Seeing Riggs' gun, the second man takes off on the heels of the Captain. Riggs is out the door right after them. Butters right behind him. Murtaugh last, calling --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No damage, Riggs! Remember the insurance!... Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs leads Butters and Murtaugh down the street in pursuit of the two men. The men cut across a street, dodge cars to the far side. Two CARS COLLIDE in front of Riggs. He doesn't break stride. Makes a Starsky and Hutch hood-slide over one of the cars and keeps going. Murtaugh, meanwhile, has been overtaken by Butters, who takes another angle on the fleeing suspects and dodges cars across the busy street. Murtaugh knows he can't keep up. Looks around. Sees a young man on a restaurant delivery bike. Pulls out his wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Two hundred for the bike. Fifty for the food. Murtaugh hops on and pedals away. DOWN STREET c54 The suspects bang into people as they run up the sidewalk. Riggs and Butters weave through behind them. Murtaugh wheels along in traffic, catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two bad guys turn in. Riggs and Butters on their heels. The Captain runs toward Hill St., ahead. The other man breaks off to the left. Butters goes after him. Murtaugh swings in, chicken in XO sauce bouncing out of the basket, follows Riggs and the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain streaks PAST us and rounds a corner. Behind him, Murtaugh catches and passes Riggs, not a little surprised to see him on the bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain runs into a glass-walled exterior elevator just as the doors are closing. Murtaugh SKIDS up a beat later. The doors close in his face. Riggs sees this. Spots a flight of stairs. Uses a bench and a moving cart to vault to the first landing, heads for level two. Murtaugh dumps the bike, takes an alternate route using an exterior escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain looks out the glass back of the elevator and sees Riggs bounding up the stairs behind him. Realizes Riggs will make the top about the same time. Sees the elevator next to his going down. In desperation, pulls his GUN and BLOWS OUT the side WINDOW. Other people in the elevator scream in terror as he climbs out the window and leaps onto the top of the descending elevator. Riggs reacts to this and must now run back down a flight and leap over the railing. In front of him, only yards away, the Captain jumps from the elevator. He lands, losing his gun, then gets up and takes off again with Riggs in pursuit. Murtaugh, meanwhile, seeing what's happened, has reached a landing and now must turn and go down the "up" escalator. Shouts at the people in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Look out! Out of the way! Murtaugh reaches level ground, jumps on the bike again, and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around a corner comes Butters' man with Butters right on his ass. They turn into a dead-end alley. The only way out's up a flight of stairs and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man blows through busy cooks, waiters, etc. Butters jukes through right behind him. The man turns into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bam! There goes a dim sum cart... The man gets to his feet. Looks back to see Butters emerge from the kitchen. Heads for a window at the front of the building. Pushes it open and starts to jump out as -- -- Butters heads for the stairs leading down to the front entrance directly below the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man jumps from the second floor. Just as he hits the ground, the front doors fly open, and Butters tackles him to the ground. Handcuffing him --

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
