dialogues.text: Don't run, don't move, don't resist... Don't fuck with the police.

dialogues.speaker: SUSPECT
dialogues.text: Police?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Handcuffs. Gun. Badge. He sticks the tin in his face. Points out the letters.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: L.A.P.D. ‘Looking At a Pissed-off Detective.’ He jerks the man to his feet and pushes him off in the direction we last saw Riggs and Murtaugh go as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain races across Hill St. at an angle. He's heading for a narrow alley in mid-block. Anticipating where he's headed, Riggs yells to Murtaugh --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Stay with him. -- and then cuts up the street to head him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chased by Murtaugh, the Captain heads up the alley where we see two old, wooden staircases that rise up from opposing directions and meet at a single landing... Riggs suddenly appears at the alley's far end. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trapped, the Captain starts up one flight of stairs. Riggs starts up the other one facing it. As they climb, face to face, they get closer. They reach the landing, feet apart... when the Captain grabs a drainpipe and scuttles up. Riggs follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run across the roofs. Take one or two small jumps ..-. when a "seventeen"-foot span looms ahead. The Captain leaps. Makes the rooftop of the building on the other side. Murtaugh pedals along, watching from below. Screams for Riggs not to do it, but... we know Riggs. He plants. Pushes off. Launches himself through the air... Hits hard on the other side, off-balance. Starts slipping backwards and slides off the edge. Barely catches the ornate corner of the roof and is left hanging there. Murtaugh yells from below --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs, don't move! But Riggs is still struggling to hoise himself up and resume the chase. Urging himself on --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I got it. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I'll get you down.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (to himself; still flailing) C'mon, c'mon... But he's not going anywhere. And Murtaugh knows it. Looks around. Spots a dumpster nearby. Runs to it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hang on, Riggs! Murtaugh starts pushing. The dumpster barely moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butters is just rounding the corner with his prisoner, who protests -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SUSPECT
dialogues.text: But really, I didn't --

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Shut up. At which point Butters sees Murtaugh with the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Help me with this.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: What for? Murtaugh nods up. Butters looks. Sees Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Holy -- (to the Suspect) Don't you move. Butters goes to help Murtaugh. The dumpster's still barely rolling. Beckoning the Suspect --

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: What the hell you just standing there for? Get your ass over here. The guy comes over.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Push. Together, the three men move the dumpster under Riggs, just as he loses his grip. Luckily, the dumpster wasn't empty. Riggs climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: .-. Shoulda had ‘em...

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: White men can't jump, but they sure can fall.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (pissed and embarrassed; turns to the Suspect) Who's your partner? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SUSPECT
dialogues.text: I don't have a partner.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You were with him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSPECT
dialogues.text: I'm a waiter at the restaurant. I was outside having a cigarette when the other man walked up. Next thing I knew people were pulling guns and running towards me... See?... (handcuffed hands indicated) «+. Waiter's jacket, order book... Beat. Butters, Riggs, and Murtaugh share a look. Butters unlocks the handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: We'd've caught that guy if you hadn't fucked it all up. Just ‘cause you see a coupla black guys with guns, you automatically assume they gotta be bad... Get outta here, you racist motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 54
dialogues.text: thru 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh drags in.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Trish?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh enters. Finds Trish playing a Chinese game with two of the Chinese women. Other Hongs iron clothes. Still more make dinner. Murtaugh gives Trish a look. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: They insisted.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Maybe they can stay a little longer than two days. Murtaugh just shakes his head, goes into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONG's in Murtaugh's chair watching TV. Sees Murtaugh and jumps up, embarrassed to be taking liberties.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Uh, no, hey, sit, please... And it's Roger, remember?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: It's your chair.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No. It's fine. Really. Sit.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: «+. Thank you so much. Hong sits. A moment. What do you say?...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Think I'll have a drink. You want something? (surveys liquor) I'm going with tequila.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Tequila?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah. You know, Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: (not a clue) Mex-see-gor?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Give it a try. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Murtaugh pours them each a glass, straight up --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What're you watching?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: About China. Things they don't show us. Murtaugh hands him a glass. Hong raises it in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Yum buoy.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yum buoy. They toast, drink. Murtaugh looks to Hong for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Mex-see-gor.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The tequila bottle's a lot emptier. Murtaugh and Hong're practically old buddies now.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... Riggs jumps off the building with the guy handcuffed to him.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Guy almost crapped his pants... That Riggs. Crazy. But... Murtaugh's deep affection for Riggs is obvious. Hong pours them each another. Raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Bread.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ..-. Huh? Oh, yeah, toast. (toasts him) Bread. They drink. Then -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Searching.. 71. 67

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You know anybody here?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: My uncle. He pay so we can come to America.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (surprised) You been in contact with him?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: I leave message... Must be very important man now. We have own room on the ship, away from the others. When there's trouble, they put us into the..

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Lifeboat... Costs a lotta money to bring all of you here. What's your uncle do?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: In China, he's artist. Murtaugh takes this in a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Gotta be hard leaving your home.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: More hard to stay... You don't know what it's like when your children have no future. And nothing we can do.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No. But my father did. And his father before him, and his father «+. All the way back to coming here on the same kinda ship that -- (stops himself) Hell, let's not go into all that now. (drains his glass) My dad moved us to L.A. Became a cop. Changed the way things were going. Like you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: I'm old. But in America, my children have chance to make good life.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... We want the best for our kids. And grandkids... You believe I'll be a grandfather?... Where's the time go?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Don't know. Have no watch. Murtaugh and Hong share a big laugh at this... The laughs subside. Murtaugh regards Hong a moment... Then slips the watch off his own wrist.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: My pop's. He got it when he retired from the force. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: No. I cannot.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No, no, I want you to have it... Belonged to a good man. Oughta belong to another one. Long beat... Then Hong takes the watch. Slides it on.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Thank you so much, Roger. Murtaugh pours another round. Raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: To dads and their kids. And their kids' kids.

dialogues.speaker: B68 OMITTED B68
dialogues.text: thru thru cé8 C68  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs shadowboxes intently as Murtaugh works out nearby. GOMEZ, a young cop, calls from the boxing ring --

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Looking good, Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Always, Gomez. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 CONTINUED: (Al) 68

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Want to step in and go a couple rounds? Get some real exercise?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: ... My pleasure. Murtaugh intercepts Riggs as he heads for the ring. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What the hell you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Gonna go knock Gomez around a little.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Gomez is good. He made division finals.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I can handle him, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Riggs is getting killed... He loses another exchange... Suddenly grabs his shoulder in pain.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Whoa. Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Old shoulder injury... (tests it; winces) I gotta toss in the towel. Sorry, man.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Just getting it going, too... You got lucky today, Gomez Murtaugh's helping him out of the ring. Sotto --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, lucky not to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Get this shoulder back in shape, you owe me a rematch.

dialogues.speaker: GOMEZ
dialogues.text: Anytime.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We'll have the paramedics here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (still calling back) Might even train for it. Give you real problems. All smiles, Riggs goes in the locker room with Murtaugh. 69 76.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the door closes, the smile leaves Riggs' face. He sags against the wall, winded, in pain.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Better ice that shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: My shoulder's okay.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Don't be brave.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The shoulder's not hurt, Rog. I was faking it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You were faking it?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Gomez was killing me. I didn't have anything left. Murtaugh starts undressing.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Told you he was good.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: -+. It wasn't all him. Riggs moves to a bench and sits down. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I've been feeling it lately, Rog. .»+. I mean, that guy nailed me on the ship, right? Then yesterday, trying to catch him... And there's been other stuff... Figured I was just out of shape or something. But it's more than that. It's like --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You're too old for this shit?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: How about that? Finally. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: But I can't be. I'm only... (thinks about it) ... Jesus... What happened, Rog?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You can't beat the clock, Riggs. Always wins in the end. Murtaugh's doffing his sweat pants, when Butters appears.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Hey, how's it going? Murtaugh hauls up his sweats. Butters continues through.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Murphy's right. We're dinosaurs... I need your help here, Rog. What am I gonna do? Murtaugh sees Riggs needs him. Sits.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Only thing you can do. Accept it.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I've always done the job one way. All the way. It's all I know.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You'll do it a different way.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Like how?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Like I do. There's a long beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'm too old for this shit... How about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh walk in. Leo runs up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Riggs. Murtaugh. Leo comes up. He has deep scratches all over his face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Dog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Your dog scratched you like that?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Catch you drinking outta his bowl?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: It wasn't my dog. It was a P.I. job I was working.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: A dog hired you?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: People hired me. To find a missing dog.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Big case.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: This was an expensive Bolshoy, funny guy.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Borzoi.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Whatever, whatever...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: And you found it.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Sort of. See, I figured out my fee for finding it'd be more than the cost of the dog from the pound, right? So --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You got a Borzoi from the pound and convinced the people it was their little Rover.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Sasha. Communist name. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: And they bought it. A completely different dog.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Which I dyed to look like theirs. Which wasn't so fucking easy. Which is how I got the scratches.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: That's some P.I. business you got there, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Deuce Ventura, pet defective.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Committing fraud, too.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Hey, the people're happy. Under which, Leo spots Butters approaching.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I'm not here. He quickly turns away, acts busy with something as Butters walks up.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Captain Riggs. Captain Murtaugh. Murtaugh turns, reacts to Butter's closeness.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What is it, Bundles?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Just heard from the Crime Lab. Guy you chased through Chinatown? The gun he dropped matched the slugs from those bodies at the ship. He's the shooter.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: And I let him get away.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Didn't get far. He turned up dead on a rooftop nearby. Strangled with a wire. Pigeons ate his eyeballs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butter's cell PHONE RINGS under this, and he answers.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Butters... Hello?... Hello?... (hangs up) I hate cell phones... Make a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: call, get cut off. Answer a call, get cut off. Spend more time getting cut off than talking. Which is just what the phone company wants. Know why? At which point, Leo reveals himself. Leo makes

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Because they fuck you with cell phones. Okay? They fuck you with cell phones. They want you to get cut off, ‘cause then, when you call the people back, they can charge you the higher rate for the first minute all over again.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: If your fucking three-hour battery that lasts only twenty minutes isn't fucking dead.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: And if you're not behind a little fucking hill where all you get is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the sound of bad static.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Not to mention, the phones're getting smaller and smaller. Why? So they can fit more places? No, no. So they can be lost or stolen easier. So you have to buy a new one, and they can fuck you again there. Ever lost a plug-in phone at your fucking house? Ever had someone break in your fucking home and steal that big kitchen phone off the wall?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Not to mention every idiot with a scanner's listening to every fucking word you say. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Or cloning your fucking number. Calling Belgium.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: What'd I tell you? They fuck you with cell phones... Hey, ever noticed, how, at the drive-thru --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Enough, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Yeah, what am I talking to you for anyway? What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah, what're you doing here, Leo? PHONE RINGS. He answers it as he walks off.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Butters... Hello... Hello.... (no connection) Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: He'll learn to like me.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: He'd be the first.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You didn't say what you're here for.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. I got a new case, okay? Non dog-related. And I need a little information. Y'know, police files-type stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH/RIGGS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I'11l just hit the streets and sniff around for clues. Thanks for nothing. Leo starts off.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Who'd hire him anyway? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah... Hey... (calls) Leo, wait. Rog, how about if we hire Leo and put him on Uncle Benny's tail?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Benny'1ll see him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: That's the idea. Make him nuts.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What if Benny shoots him? Riggs just looks at him. Then --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Tell Leo he's hired. Riggs goes. Someone comes by collecting for a pool.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Pregnancy pool for Lorna. Five dollars. Due date's next Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... Lorna's a go-getter, she'll probably be early... I'll take Friday morning at... (off his badge number) ... [badge number]. Murtaugh pays, and the Detective goes. Riggs returns.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: All set.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. So... What'll we do the rest of the day, Captain Riggs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police helicopter flies over L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh riding back seat. Murtaugh's not enjoying himself. Riggs is a kid in a candy store. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: This is great.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Can't believe I let you talk me into this.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Beats sitting around the office.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: There's two kinds of choppers. Ones that've crashed, and ones that're gonna crash.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Think positive, remember? Let's fly over my place, and see if the construction guys're sleeping on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper flies overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh's eyes're closed. Riggs looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What do you know? They're working... Hey, there's Lorna.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN FROM CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Lorna emerges from the trailer, gets in her car and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs addresses the pilots through his headset.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Follow the green four-wheel drive. The helicopter banks over. Murtaugh hates it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Having a little fun. 84. 73 74 75 76 77  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorna's eating donuts. The CAR PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA AND RIGGS 79
dialogues.text: Riggs is on a cell phone in the chopper, flying a little behind and to one side of Lorna. He observes her with high-power, zoom binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Hi, honey.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Errand. Then Lamaze at the Murtaughs'.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The Beijing Hilton... What're you eating, donuts?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: .».. Yeah. How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Good guess. Lorna takes a hand off the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Remember to keep both hands on the wheel when you're driving. She is surprised again. Hand back on the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Okay... Riggs loves this.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Where are you? There's a lot of background noise. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We're near a construction site... I'll bet you're drinking coffee, too. You know the doctor said that's not okay. Lorna regards the cup in her drink holder.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: It's decaf, he said I could have one cup a day, and... (looks to see if he's next to her) ... how the hell you know everything I'm doing?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'm psycho. I mean, psychic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bridal magazine lies on the seat next to the donuts.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Riggs?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Car phone's expensive.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah. We should probably wave good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Wave good-bye?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Right side in the air. Lorna looks out. The chopper dips into her line of sight. Riggs waves from the helo.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Dick.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh in the back seat. Two cops up front. Murtaugh has a large coffee stain on his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What do you care if I want to go home and change my shirt?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Coffee stain's just not something that'd bother me.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Look how you dress.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? Because I'm not sporting those expensive suits?... Not many cops are.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (so the cops don't hear) Means I don't understand where all the money's coming from.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Where do you think it's coming from?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I_don't know.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. Trish came into a little money from an aunt who died.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. Why didn't you tell me before?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What's that car doing? Up ahead, a Suburban with darkened windows pulls out of Murtaugh's driveway and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Right here, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser pulls over. Riggs and Murtaugh get out, thanking the cops, who drive off.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Wonder who that was? Riggs regards two cars parked in front of the house with Explorer and Rianne's Pontiac: a black four-door Mercedes and a new, black Continental.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Whose cars are these? Riggs and Murtaugh hold a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh enters from outside, alone, nonchalant. Trish, Rianne and Lorna are there.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hey. Whose van was that? Five Chinese thugs, including Chu and Yee, suddenly appear from hiding. Guns on Murtaugh, guns on the girls. As Murtaugh's disarmed --

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: They took the Hongs. They're gonna kill us. Murtaugh looks up to see Wah Sing Ku reveal himself at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doing here? At which point, one of the thugs sees a red laser dot on his nose... REVEAL Riggs, outside the back window, his 9mm in one hand, Murtaugh's ankle gun in the other. The two thugs he has the drop on surrender their guns. The rest follow suit. Lorna grabs a gun as Murtaugh gets his back and draws down on Ku. Riggs enters.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What have we here?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: They took the Hongs. And look who's on the stairs, Uncle Benny's friend. Riggs moves around to see Ku.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Where the hell'd you take ‘em? A thug makes his move. Flicks open an ice-pick stiletto as he grabs Lorna. Presses the point to her pregnant belly. Riggs is instantly compliant.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Okay... Take it easy... He drops his gun. Murtaugh drops his. The guy with the knife relaxes... when suddenly, Lorna arch-stomps him. Elbows him through the kitchen doorway. Slams the pocket door on his knife arm. Takes the knife. Jams it through the door, inches from the guy's face. And all hell breaks loose... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everybody's going for the pile of guns on the floor. Riggs has three guys to contend with. Guys with good kung fu. Riggs is at his outer limits. Kicks and punches and bites and scratches and nut-crushes. Murtaugh's got one guy after him. The guy's swinging a standing lamp. Murtaugh's about to hit him with a porcelain bowl, when Trish yells --

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Not the bowl. Murtaugh puts it down, dispatches with a body slam against a wall. Ku just watches from the stairs, eyes glued to Riggs as he fights off his three. Ku seeing what kind of stuff Riggs has, how good he is... until Riggs suddenly has a gun in his hand. About to swing it up... when Ku drops down through the stairwell... He can fly?... In a series of stunning moves, Ku disarms Riggs, and sweeps up the pistol. Pops up with it as Murtaugh pops up with his gun, and Riggs pops up again with his own Beretta. Two guns against one. Beat. Ku surrenders his. Another beat. Relief... And then Ku does something truly amazing. Fast as a bolt of lightning... reaches for Riggs' Beretta and in a single move disassembles it. Riggs is still holding the grip and trigger, but Ku has the entire barrel and slide mechanism. And he's not done... Cracks Murtaugh on the wrist with the slide and disarms him. Next a flying scissors kick. Riggs and Murtaugh hit the floor... It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ku looks on as his men finish binding everyone. Riggs and Murtaugh wonder whether it'll be bullets in the head or the quiet work of the stiletto on neck arteries. It's neither. It's worse... Ku flicks ON a BUTANE LIGHTER. Turns the flame up high. Reaches for the curtains, which quickly catch fire. He lights more curtains. Papers on a desk. A lamp shade. Anything that burns. Then barks in Chinese to two of his men.

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: Stay with them until you're sure they can't get out. Ku, Yee and Chu go. The remaining two thugs stand guard as the flames spread. Soon, the house is an inferno. The smoke's choking. The thugs still don't budge. It looks like they're going up in flames, too... when they finally give each other a look, then turn and run out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 thru

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Instantly, Riggs and Murtaugh mobilize, trying to get loose... They can't... Fire's everywhere... when a closet door under the stairs opens, and Ping emerges. He'd been hiding. The bad guys missed him... Ping sees everyone tied up in the living room... His eyes go to the children's scissors lying on the floor, where he'd been doing paper cut-outs earlier... Grabs the scissors... Begins cutting the tape binding Riggs... it's laborious; the tape's strong, the small, kid's scissors not meant for heavy-duty cutting... But slowly, the tape gives way... And then Riggs is loose... Riggs cuts Murtaugh free. Throws a chair through the front window. Then he and Murtaugh move Ping and the women out, not bothering to untie them.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 81
dialogues.text: thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all outside. Safe. Riggs cutting Lorna free as Murtaugh does the same for Trish and Rianne.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: My home...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Anybody got car keys?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: (indicating house) Mine were in my purse.

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: Mine are under the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: C'mon, Rog. Riggs pulls Murtaugh away from the sight of his burning house. Getting in Rianne's Pontiac, Riggs realizes --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Radio... He moves to Lorna's Explorer. The door's locked. He BREAKS the GLASS. Grabs a portable police radio. Jumps back in with Murtaugh. Nick and Carrie drive up. Murtaugh sees them, calls -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Nick, take care of your mom and Rianne. As they peel out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving. Into the radio --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: 3-William-56. Have Air Ops switch to tac 5.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger, 3-William-56. Riggs switches radio channels. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 3-William-56, Air 12.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Need your eyes, guys. We're looking for a black four-door Mercedes and a black Continental. Vicinity of Ladera at the freeway. Over.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mercedes and a Continental... Shouldn't be hard to find in this town.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Just give it a shot, huh?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's a rog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police chopper surveys the streets below.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 3-William-56, Air 12...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Go, Air 12. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Will wonders never cease? We got two black Mercedes, one headed east, one headed west. The east one just got on the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We'll take that one. You try and locate the Continental.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: How you know we're chasing the right one?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's headed east... China's east.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: It's also west.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Rog...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Think positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh floors it up the ramp and onto the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hauling ass through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What the hell'd they take the Hongs for, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: That guy's with Benny Chan. Gotta be something with the smuggling. Want their money...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hong said his uncle already paid... Hong left him a message. He's the only one who knew they were at my house... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: There they are. We see the black Mercedes ahead.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's the last two guys.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We don't have guns. What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One half of a double-wide mobile home is under tow ahead. In a lane between the thugs and Riggs and Murtaugh. The open side of the mobile home is covered by clear plastic and is closer to Riggs and Murtaugh. The thugs are slowed on the other, aluminum-clad side of the mobile home by a car entering from an on-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Pull up next to that mobile home. Riggs is already on the move. Climbs into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Have a chat with 'em... Get me close to the back bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's singing to the RADIO, oblivious to what's happening in his side mirror, where we see Murtaugh steering closer and closer to the mobile home... until Riggs opens the back door, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs grabs onto the mobile home. Swings out onto the back bumper. There's a WINDOW within reach. He SMASHES it, climbs into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's house. Fully furnished. Riggs crosses to a window on the thugs' side and looks out.  89 90 91

dialogues.speaker: OUT WINDOW 89
dialogues.text: There's the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs moves to a side door. Opens it. Reaches through the open driver's window of the Mercedes. Grabs the unsuspecting driver and hauls him right out of his seat into the mobile home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's suddenly gone. The surprised passenger jumps for the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs is pounding the shit out of the thug... when the guy effects a reversal, nails Riggs back. The thug pulls his gun. Riggs knocks it away. Out the door and gone. From there, it's all fists and feet. In and out of rooms, over counters and furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH the plastic we can see Riggs and the kung-fu killer punching and kicking. BACK IN MOBILE HOME c92 Riggs heaves a side table at the thug. The thug ducks. The table slams against the plastic. Riggs tackles the thug. Drives them both into the plastic. Now, they're fighting in a bowed-out bubble of Visqueen. Over pavement ripping by at 55 mph below them. The plastic begins tearing away... Rips loose. Both men tumble out and -- EXT. FREEWAY Dg92 -- land on the upside-down side table. Slide along the freeway atop the length of the plastic, still attached to the moving trailer... And there, on the flipped-over table skimming over the road, the fight continues... The thug's choking Riggs... until Riggs makes a desperate move. Knocks the guy off. (CONTINUED)

CONTINUED: Dg92 Grabs the plastic just before the table slides off and into traffic, which is exactly where the thug finds himself after tumbling to a stop. Face to bumper with the Express bus. For the last second of his life. Murtaugh speeds up to get the truck driver's attention. HONKS. Trying to get him to pull over. No luck. And Riggs isn't just ski-boarding behind the mobile home, either. The remaining thug has now dropped back in the Mercedes guns it after him... Riggs is trying to pull himself toward the mobile home. Sees the Mercedes about to crush him. Breaks a leg off the table. Hurls it backward and -- -- THROUGH the thug's WINDSHIELD, where it stops, inches from the guy's nose. He yanks it through. Goes after Riggs again... Closes in... He's about to run Riggs over... when Murtaugh suddenly SLAMS Rianne's CAR against the flank of the Mercedes. Drives him sideways away from Riggs. Murtaugh tries to maneuver the cop car close enough to th sliding table so that Riggs can climb in, as -- -- the Mercedes now pulls around the other side of Murtaugh. SLAMS into Murtaugh, driving him towards Riggs, who gets his feet up just in time to fend the car off. The thug pulls his PISTOL, FIRES at Murtaugh, who ducks just in time... And then the thug has a choice: keep firing or worry about the CHERRY-TOPS approaching fast from behind. He FIRES one last SHOT, then opts for saving his ass. Punches it. Murtaugh maneuvers close to Riggs. Riggs reaches. This is bad. But the plastic's ripping. Bad's better than worse... Riggs grabs the sedan... Abandons the table... Drags... Hauls himself in the open window and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs lands in the seat... Murtaugh's relieved.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Jesus, Riggs... Riggs jams his foot atop Murtaugh's on the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Let's go, Rog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh pursue the Mercedes... Close in... The thug suddenly veers from the fast lane all the way across the freeway. Takes an exit. Hoping Riggs and Murtaugh won't make it. They almost don't. The ramp curves around a ten-story glass office building. The ramp's also under construction... The thug crashes a barricade. Narrowly misses a worker. No such luck for Riggs and Murtaugh. They're gonna plow through the entire Caltrans crew... Murtaugh swerves. Into a pile of lumber... The car's launched into the air .-. Off the ram... Through the air... Toward the office building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're at your desk, playing Free Cell and watching out for the boss. You realize there's a car coming through your window. Straight at you. A few stories up. Riggs and Murtaugh land inside the open-plan office in a SHOWER of TEMPERED GLASS. People dive aside. The CAR snags computers and copiers and every other thing as it ROARS past cubicles... when -- -- Riggs sees the Mercedes moving along next to them outside on the ramp. Keeps his foot on Murtaugh's.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs -- They're flying down a corridor. Out windows to the side, we can see the exit ramp inclining toward an intersection below. Fast approaching ahead is the other exterior side of the glass building.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs!... Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crash! The car bursts through... arcs through the air... Lands on the exit ramp behind the Mercedes. BLOWING TIRES, SKIDDING all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thug can't believe what he's seeing in the mirror behind him. He's distracted. Approaching the intersection at the bottom of the ramp, where --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- an 18-wheeler suddenly emerges from a tunnel under the freeway... the T-bone COLLISION is monstrous. For the driver of the Mercedes, it's fatal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucker yanks on the AIR BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh see the 18-wheeler locking its brakes. Right in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: THREE FEET M92
dialogues.text: Two of Murtaugh's, one of Riggs', mash down on the brake pedal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rianne's car swerves... Spins out... Slams broadside into the rear of the stopped semi. Murtaugh's side. Every- thing above the doors ripped all to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Murtaugh. In Riggs' lap. Safe... No sound except the ENGINE HISSING, overheated. And a CLOSEUP VIEW of a sticker on the truck's rear bumper, which reads: "If you can read this, you're too close."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hongs wait for whatever's next. Scared and confused... A door opens. Chu steps in. Motions for Hong to come with him. Beat. Hong goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Containing an enormous printing press. Stacks of paper next to it. A number of workers readying the press for operation, loading ink, etc. Hong enters with Chu. ku is there. Standing near an older Chinese man who's bent over a table, meticulously engraving a metal plate. ku taps the man. Indicates Hong. The man turns. Hong's surprised to see who it is. In Chinese (subtitles) -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: Uncle... He and the uncle, CHUNG, go to each other. Embrace.

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG
dialogues.text: You're all here?

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: »-. Yes. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: In return for bringing you to the U.S., your uncle is doing work for us. (to Chung) Your family's here. Now, you finish the job.

dialogues.speaker: HONG
dialogues.text: (looking around) What kind of job?

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: No time to talk now. Ku nods to Chu. As Chu moves to take Hong out, Hong and the uncle exchange a look that communicates Hong's fear to the old man. Chung grows worried. To Ku --

dialogues.speaker: CHUNG
dialogues.text: Take them to their new homes. When they're safe, I'll finish. Whereupon Ku's pent-up frustration and anger explode. The attack is vicious, swift. The victim slammed backward across Ku's knee. His neck snapped. Just like that... And then Hong's dead eyes staring off at nothing... Ku drops him to the floor. To Chung --

dialogues.speaker: KU
dialogues.text: Finish now or watch the others die. OFF Chung, no choice and Hong dead in front of him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAFD's on scene, but there's nothing to do but hose down the smoldering embers as Lorna, Trish, Rianne, Nick, Carrie, and Ping look on... Another cop car drops off Riggs and Murtaugh. Murtaugh just stares at the devasta- tion as he gets out and moves to Trish's side. Lorna looks to Riggs. His expression tells her they failed. Ping's looking at Riggs, too, and can also read his face. Riggs kneels in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We'll get your family back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ping's eyes are full of tears. Another beat. Riggs draws the boy close. Hugs him tight. Maybe not too nuts to be someone's father, as -- -- Murtaugh, Trish, Rianne, Nick, and Carrie stand, arms around each other, eyes filled with tears, watching firefighters wet down the remains of their home.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Lotta years. Lotta memories.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: -.. We'll still have the memories. Murtaugh looks at his wife. Her eyes meet his.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: It's not the house that matters, it's the people. Without us, it's just two-by-fours... We were talking about a new place anyway. Trish loves him for saying it. Whether he means it or not... Under which, Butters arrives and joins them.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Heard everything on the tac frequency... I'm sorry about your house.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (beat; then, by way of introduction) This is Detective --

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Butters.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: My wife, Trish. My kids, Carrie, Nick, and Rianne... And that's Riggs' -- (almost says "wife") That's Lorna and Ping.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: (mostly to Rianne) Glad everybody's okay. (then) Got a make on the guys who did it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A look between Murtaugh and Riggs. Answer:

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Uncle Benny.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Leo.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Who's got a phone? As someone hands him a cell phone, and he dials --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (to Trish) You'll be okay, baby?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Go find 'em, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Trish can come home with me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Leo. Riggs. Where is he?... Stay right there, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butters is driving. Murtaugh sits up front with him. After a few minutes --

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Captain Murtaugh, look, I know it's kind of a bad time. But I think there's something you'd better know about me. Murtaugh glances towards Riggs, seated in back.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: .+. This isn't easy...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (stepping in) Yeah, well, I think maybe I know what it is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah. And it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: It is?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: People have a right to do whatever makes 'em happy. Just don't expect me to like it, too.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: I understand. It's hard for you.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: It's impossible for me.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: +. I just hope we can see each other on the holidays, Christmas...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Christmas? Why the hell would we see each other on Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Okay. Forget I said anything.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I told you. Do what you want to do. Just leave me out of it. Got that?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Now, I don't want to hear any more about it. Murtaugh sees Riggs smiling in back.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What're you grinning at?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 thru 97 98

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Start thinking about how we're gonna get inside that office and talk to Benny.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Already figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSAK. Uncle Benny's bodyguard, Yee, waits. The door opens. Leo enters. Moaning loudly. Holding his jaw. In pain. He goes to the DENTAL RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: My tooth... My tooth...

dialogues.speaker: DENTAL RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: What is it, sir?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: My tooth... Oh, God... Help me... Arghhh...

dialogues.speaker: DENTAL RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: The doctor's with a patient.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: He's gotta see me. He's gotta see me. He's gotta see me.

dialogues.speaker: DENTAL RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Can't you go to your own dentist?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: He's in Cleveland. I'm visiting L.A. I was in Chinatown looking for those black kung-fun slippers for my nephew, and... Arghhh...

dialogues.speaker: DENTAL RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I -- I'll get Dr. Cheng. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSAK. Uncle Benny's undergoing a procedure by DR. SAMUEL CHENG, D.D.S., when the Receptionist enters.

dialogues.speaker: DENTAL RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Doctor. A man just walked in. He's in a lot of pain. Cheng excuses himself to Benny in Chinese, and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh, and Butters wait.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: You sure he can pull this off?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Leo? He's got an M.A. in B.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSAK. Cheng and his staff seat Leo, still moaning.

dialogues.speaker: CHENG
dialogues.text: Let's have a look... Cheng barely touches Leo's cheek. He howls in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh, and Butters hear the howl.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: That's the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSAK. Riggs peeks in a back door marked "Private." No one's there. Everyone's busy with the moaning Leo. Riggs enters with Murtaugh and Butters. They find Uncle Benny's exam room. See him sitting in the dental chair, his back to the door. They hold a quick conference. After which Riggs and Murtaugh pull out handcuffs, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSAK. Leo's moaning continues 0.S. As Butters shuts the door, Riggs and Murtaugh move up behind Uncle Benny. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Swiftly grab his arms, pull them back, and handcuff them to the dental chair. Too fast for Benny to react. He's pinned in the chair. Opens his mouth to yell... when Butters sticks a gun in his face.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Shut up. The .45 stops him. Riggs and Murtaugh move to face him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Chinese dentist time -- tooth- hurty. Benny says nothing. Then relaxes. Regains his composure. He'll play this out.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: If you found me here, the man in the red truck must be yours. I thought maybe F.B.I... What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Where are the Hongs?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: I don't know the Hongs.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You know 'em. Their uncle paid you big to get ‘em outta China.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: More about smuggling? We went through that before.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: We're going through it again.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: I have nothing to say to you. Beat. Murtaugh picks up a wicked-looking dental tool.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: This looks painful.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: And you won't use it. Any more than he'll shoot me... You're cops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: People burn down my house and try to kill our families, it's not cops and criminals anymore. It's personal. And I'll do what it takes. Uncle Benny's legs suddenly flick out at them in a quick succession of kicks. Surprisingly fast and agile for an old man. Riggs sees a nitrous oxide tank. Turns it on full blast. Clamps the mask over Benny's face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: This'1l settle you down... Benny struggles against the mask. Holds his breath.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Breathe. Riggs jabs him in the gut, causing him to gulp nitrous... Benny slowly succumbs. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Feeling mellow now, Benny?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: -.. Benny? Benny starts SINGING a Chinese children's song.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Guy's wasted. Riggs removes the nitrous mask from Benny's face. Hands it to Butters as he regards the warbling tong boss.

dialogues.speaker: NITROUS MASK
dialogues.text: We hear the GAS continue to HISS.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Great. What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. Maybe the gas'1l make him talk. Uncle Benny. Hey, Uncle Benny.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Where're the Hongs? Benny doesn't answer. Beat. Riggs leans close. Makes a funny face at him. Breaks Benny up.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Okay. C'mon. Where're the Hongs, Benny? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: (can't help it) ... Renminbi.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Where's Renminbi?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Dumb question. Benny goes on laughing.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Okay, let's do this again. Benny, where are the Hongs?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Renminbi.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's renminbi mean, Benny?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Renminbi means... renminbi. Benny finds that funny, too.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: He's not gonna tell us shit. We're wasting our time.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Time? Time for forefathers.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Forefathers?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Washington? Jefferson? Those forefathers? That really cracks Benny up. Beat... Then Riggs suddenly starts laughing... Murtaugh just looks at Riggs a moment... Then a smile breaks out on Murtaugh's face, too... And then Butters is laughing.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: I'm screwing my wife's sisters.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Good one, Benny. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Not so good if my wife finds out. Benny laughs. Meanwhile, Butters has found a huge dental syringe.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: I got an idea. Let's shoot a buncha novocaine into this happy motherfucker. Make his legs all numb, then watch him try to walk and shit. Have a big, goddamn laugh... Where's the novocaine at? Whereupon Murtaugh sees something. To Butters --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What's in your hand? Butters raises the hand holding his gun.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: My gun.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No, your other hand. He raises it. There's the NITROUS MASK. Still HISSING.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: A nut cup.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Shit. We're stoned... Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (turns off nitrous) ..-. Nut cup. That's a funny son-in-law you got, Rog. Beat. Murtaugh stops laughing... Did he hear right?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: After tonight it'll be too late.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Too late for what, Benny?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs... Why'd you call him my son-in-law? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Murtaugh's 111.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Buy forefathers back at forefathers store.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: What's he keep talking about his ancestors for?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (harder) Riggs, why'd you call him my son- in-law?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Huh?... Oh...

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Because I am. confused. Looks back at Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He is, Rog. He's the father of Rianne's baby.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: I thought he knew.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: But... He can't be... He's...

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: I'm what?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: Bloody marvelous...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Who's the guy from your office, Benny? The one who burned down Rog's house?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE BENNY
dialogues.text: ... Very dangerous... At which point the dentist, Cheng, enters. Stops. Leo sticks

dialogues.speaker: CHENG
dialogues.text: What's going on here? his head in.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I couldn't stall him any longer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cheng turns off the nitrous.

dialogues.speaker: CHENG
dialogues.text: Who are you? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: .-». Leaving. Right, Rog?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. Right.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Anything happens to the Hongs, we'll be after you, Benny. (drops handcuff keys in his lap) Keep the cuffs.  105 106 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gets on. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: So? How'd it go? Did he talk? What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (to Butters) You're my son-in-law?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: He said 'you're my son-in-law?'

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: (to Murtaugh) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: .»». Wait... He's your son-in- law?... Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. We hear a punch. Riggs comes flying out. Onto the floor. Raises up. Shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What'd you hit me for?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: For keeping it from me. And letting me think he was... (to Butters) Soon as we find the Hongs, you, me, and Rianne'll be getting into this. Murtaugh goes. Leo helps Riggs up.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: How come I didn't know about this?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Why would anyone tell you?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Whatever, whatever... Screw you guys. I gotta go to my real dentist now. And you're paying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru 109

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED A107
dialogues.text: thru 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh, and Butters listen to the POLICE RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: NG, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Renminbi's the currency in mainland China. Means 'the People's money.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ng's on a portable police radio.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: What else did Benny say? INTERCUT Ng and our guys. Into the radio --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: He kept going on about his ancestors. Something about buying 'em back. How it'd be too late after tonight. Mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Not that I can think of. Murtaugh takes the mike.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What about the guy who torched my house? In the restaurant, it was like Benny was scared of him.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: If Benny's scared of him, he's from China, and that's not good ... Listen up, boys. I don't know what's going on, but Chinese gangs kill anyone who gets in their way. That includes cops and their families. You watch your asses.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ng.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Keep me posted.  Alll thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheriff's car's parked by Lorna's Explorer. Butters' car pulls up. Riggs and Murtaugh get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh enter. A sheriff's DEPUTY watches over Lorna, Ping and Trish.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: What's going on, Riggs?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's not safe for you guys here. I'll explain in the car. As Riggs gets his coat and guns for him and Lorna --

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Where're we going?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: He's driving you and Ping to your uncle's. I'm taking Trish to her relatives. (to Deputy) You guys mind driving me and my wife?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Sheriff's Department's always here to help L.A.P.D.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (to Trish) I sent Lee Butters to pick up Rianne.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Lee Butters?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know... her husband? My son-in-law. The father of my grandchild? Trish is nailed. She and Murtaugh go. Riggs starts to explain to Lorna. She punches him. (CONTINUED)
Alll thru

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'll get Ping. He does. And as they go -- IN A SERIES OF SHOTS Allg Hong's family waits inside their warehouse room. In the other room, with Ku and Benny looking on, Hong's uncle, Chung, finishes engraving a plate. The plate is fitted to a large printing press. Sheets of currency paper, on which are already printed the other elements of a Chinese bill, are run through the press. The engraved plate adds the final element. The first sheets are inspected. Ku's satisfied. The press starts hammering out the rest of the sheets. As it does this, and the money's cut and packaged -- -- Ku kills the uncle, Chung. Uncle Benny's next. Strangled by a wire garrote hidden inside Ku's Buddhist prayer beads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ping sits in the front seat with Riggs and Lorna. Up ahead, lights flash and the barricade lowers at a train crossing. Riggs slows, stops. A train approaches in the distance. Beat. Something's on Riggs' mind...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Flying next to you in the chopper... I saw the bridal magazine in the car. Beat. Lorna doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You want to get married, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: No... (then) Yeah, I want it... But it's okay with me if you don't. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me before?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Don't want to put pressure on you... If you're ready some day, great. If not... I love you, Riggs. I'll take you any way I get you.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You're sure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: If I needed it to be another way, believe me, I'd tell you. They look at each other a long time... When up ahead, lights flash, and the barricade lowers at a train crossing. Riggs slows, stops at the barricade. A train approaches in the distance. Lorna feels her tummy.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Baby's kicking. Riggs reaches over and feels... so does Ping. The TRAIN'S HORN sounds for the crossing. The bright headlight illuminates the car... What happens next happen very quickly... BAM! Riggs' truck is struck from behind. Shoved through the crossing arm. Being pushed in front of the train... Riggs sees what's happening. Throws it in reverse. Stomps on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs' rear tires smoke in reverse. But the truck behind has more leverage going forward. Riggs' truck keeps sliding ahead toward the train track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accelerator on the floor. Still moving into the path of the train... Riggs and Lorna both draw their guns. Turn. FIRE backward, through the rear WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yee's the driver. Another Chinese guy with him. They both duck below the dashboard as BULLETS SHATTER the WINDSHIELD. Yee never letting his foot off the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Lorna FIRE out. They're still being pushed forward. Blinding light fills the car... They're a second from annihilation... when Riggs slams the shifter into "drive." Floors it.  122 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs' truck shoots through the crossing. The truck behind, accelerator still down but now relieved from pushing any weight, automatically shoots ahead, as well. Too late to clear the tracks... BOOM! The locomotive nails the truck's ass end. Flips them. Spins them. But doesn't kill them... A second locomotive does that. Coming down a parallel set of tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skidding to a stop. Riggs turns to Lorna and Ping.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You guys okay?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: «+. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs gets out. The Suburban's a fireball down the tracks. In b.g., we hear the POLICE RADIO. Then, from inside the car!--

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Roger's calling you. Riggs takes the mike.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: They just tried to kill us, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh's riding with Butters.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Everybody okay? INTERCUT Riggs and Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We're fine. They're just about well-done... I'm sick of these fuckers, Rog. I want to take ‘em out, now.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... Better meet me and Butters downtown. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: ... They found my watch.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH'S FATHER'S WATCH 126
dialogues.text: Murtaugh turns it over in his hands. REVEAL he's in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, Riggs enters with Lorna. They cross to Murtaugh.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: They killed Hong, his uncle, and Uncle Benny, too. Bodies're in there.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Where's the rest of the family?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: They're okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butters, Ng, and Tony are there. Riggs, Lorna and Murtaugh enter.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I.N.S. raided a Chinese sweatshop. Hong's family was being held there. They led 'em back here. Butters walks up.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Look what we found. They were printing funny money. Ink's still wet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Riggs regards the money. It's a sheet of renminbi still missing the engraved portraits.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What the hell're they printing Chinese money for? Can you even exchange it here?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Only in China.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hong's uncle was an artist. Maybe an engraver. Bringing the family over could've been his payment for doing the job.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: .+. Benny talked about buying his forefathers back.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: You said ancestors.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Ancestors, forefathers...

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Not forefathers. Four fathers. The number four. Top guys in one of the old Hong Kong Triads. Reds jailed 'em when they took over Hong Kong. We're hearing they were just moved outta prison.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: They must be involved somehow. (to Benny Chan's body ) «+. Got in over your head, Uncle Benny.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: .-. A guy from the State Department was killed the other day. Car was shoved in front of a train. Same thing they tried on us. It's all gotta be connected. Lorna suddenly spots Ping in the other room approaching the doorway into this room. She quickly moves to inter- cept him, takes him back outside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Ten to one I know where they took the money.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We're outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge. Lorna's with Ping. Riggs' eyes meet hers.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We're going after 'em. She couldn't stop him if she wanted.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Watch your butt. OFF Lorna, as Riggs and the others drive off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cop car with our guys guns toward a showdown --

dialogues.speaker: NG, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: «+. Uncle Benny was doing a lotta business with National Ansco. Company's owned by the Chinese government. Big set-up at the harbor. Right now, they're breaking down machines from our old factories and shipping ‘em home... Only problem's the place is what's called a Foreign Trade Zone. Going in there's a federal, red-tape deal. We don't have the authority.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we got a problem with authority anyway.  129 130 123.

dialogues.speaker: CURRENCY SCANNER 130
dialogues.text: As it scans a Chinese bill. Intricacies of the bill's design are displayed on a screen. REVEAL we're in -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ku and a dozen Triad gangsters, including Fan and Chu, face the PRC General and thirty armed soldiers holding The Four Fathers. All in suspended animation while a PRC egghead operates the scanner. The scan's complete. The egghead signals the bill's good. The General nods to his men to release the Four Fathers... when we hear a CAR HORN HONKING "Shave and a haircut." Everyone turns to see Riggs and Murtaugh driving in. Slowly. Butters, Ng, and Tony following in their car. The soldiers' automatics swinging over onto them... Riggs and Murtaugh stop. Get out. No guns. Nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Hi, gang.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (tins 'em) L.A.P.D. Riggs surveys the situation.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: So this is what Uncle Benny meant. Buying the Four Fathers outta jail. Which general's out to line his pockets, I wonder? Speakee English?

dialogues.speaker: PRC GENERAL
dialogues.text: What do you want? Riggs hands over the faceless renminbi.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Need toilet paper back home? That's all the renminbi's good for. As the General checks the renminbi --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You can take the Four Pops back to China. We don't give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah, do what you want with 'em. Just don't leave ‘em here. Whereupon the General pulls a GUN and SHOOTS two Four Fathers in the head. Fan kills him before he SHOOTS the oldest Father and the pit viper (Ku's father). Hits him with a BURST... And all hell breaks loose. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The battle pits the Triad against Riggs, Murtaugh, Butters, Ng, Tony, and the PRC Army. It rapidly divides into separate skirmishes that sometimes overlap. It's a war. Most important, we're counting the bullets. The PRC guys have, at most, three thirty- five round mags. In real life, set on full auto, that goes fast. The Triad guys are slightly less well-armed. Riggs, Murtaugh, et al have their pistols and a couple extra mags each. What this means is, as people run out of ammo, they're first diving after dead guys' guns, and then they're going to hands and feet and whatever they can grab to hit with or throw. The gun battle will transform into a realistic martial arts melee. During the fight: Ku's goal's to protect the two remaining Four Fathers and get them out. In the process, he takes on multiple opponents, armed and not. We see the two remaining Four Fathers' martial arts skills on display. Riggs suffers an early flesh wound. It slows him but doesn't stop him. Tony's killed. Ng and Butters both nail the shooter. Riggs and Murtaugh end up behind the stack of renminbi. Out of breath. Nicked here and there. As they check their ammo --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah. (re: the bullet hole in his side) Went through and through. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Was this a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It was an idea. One in the chamber, three in the mag. You?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Down to the wheel gun. Six. A Triad guy appears. Murtaugh SHOOTS him TWICE.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Four. BULLETS RIP the stack of money. Bills float down around them. Beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Trish never mentioned a rich aunt.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: The one you said died and left her all the money... I.A.S. heard you're on the take.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I'm on the take?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Sounded crazy to me, too. But now I don't know what the hell's going on. Why're you lying to me, Rog? Murtaugh looks sick. It must be bad. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Ever hear of Ebony Clark?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: She writes those cheesy sex novels. Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: «+. Trish is Ebony Clark.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Trish? Your wife Trish? Writes books? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (nods ) Started a couple years ago. Now she's a bestseller. Even has her own line of lingerie. Remember those shorts with the hearts? They're from the men's collection .+. I didn't want people to know. It's kinda embarrassing. Beat. More GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Two shots left.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I read some Ebony Clark. Trish has a pretty vivid imagination. (then) It is made-up, isn't it, Rog? I mean, you guys aren't into all that... Stuff's kinda kinky, y'know... Are you?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (beat; smiles) Kids are outta the house these days. Beat. Then more GUNFIRE. This time, they're driven from cover and have to split up. In the midst of the fighting, Riggs meets Ng.

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: How we doing?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You got me. They spot Ku and the pit viper moving by in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Who's the guy in the white pajamas?

dialogues.speaker: NG
dialogues.text: Name's Wah Sing Ku. The Four Father with him's his real dad. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Like Four Father like son, huh?... I'm gonna go see if I can break up the family. Riggs heads off in Ku's direction. Across the room, Murtaugh FIRES TWO of his four... when a Triad guy he doesn't see draws a bead on him. FIRES +. And suddenly Butters is there. Knocks Murtaugh down. Takes the bullet himself. Murtaugh comes off the ground, POPS the shooter, and moves to Butters.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Butters.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Hey, you said my real name. The wound shouldn't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: This is the first time I've been shot. Am I okay?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (sees Ng) Ng! (indicates Butters) Watch him. Ng comes over as Murtaugh moves on. Checks the cylinder as he goes. One bullet left... when the old Four Father is there. Drives a kick into Murtaugh's kidneys. A monkey fist in the neck. Murtaugh fights unconsciousness. Sees him moving in again. Finds a paint spray gun at hand. Sees the old man's glasses. Sprays... A pink mist covers the lenses. The old guy has to take them off. Losing his glasses doesn't change his kung fu -- it's as good as ever -- it's just now all his blows're landing half a foot short. Which Murtaugh realizes. Stays out of range. Waits for an opening. Then clonks him with the butt of his revolver. Riggs FIRES his last two. Meets Chu mano-a-mano... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chu makes Riggs suffer... when a PRC Army guy appears and takes Chu out... A moment of acknowledgement between him and Riggs. Then Ku and his father end the moment. Strike like a lightning. Ku drops Riggs as the father kills the soldier... Ku moves to kill Riggs with a punch. Across the room, Murtaugh sees Ku about to kill Riggs. Raises his GUN. It's a long shot. Murtaugh pauses. Cricks his neck. FIRES. An instinct alerts Ku. He sees Murtaugh fire. Moves just enough to avoid the slug... Murtaugh keeps pulling the trigger. The hammer falling on empty chambers... Ku senses something behind him. Turns to find his father's taken Murtaugh's slug and bleeds profusely from the hole it made in his pericardium. Ku moves to him. Catches him as he falls. Supports him as he heads for a door. Finds himself engaged by a PRC soldier. Dispatches him despite the burden of his father's body. And exits. Murtaugh moves to Riggs. They're both bruised and beat-up Exhausted. The battle's basically over. Bodies everywhere Murtaugh hoists Riggs to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out on a fucked-up, old pier. Ku supporting his father as he looks for an escape... when the father sags, drops to the ground... Ku bends over him. Their eyes meet. They hold the look for a long time... Father and son... And then the father's eyes roll back. A DOOR BANGS OPEN a SHORT DISTANCE AWAY. Riggs and Murtaugh stumble out of the warehouse. See Ku kneeling next to the body. Bowed. His brow touching his father's .-. Ku lifts his head. Sees Riggs and Murtaugh... Ku has nothing left to live for now. Nothing except to kill the two men responsible for his failure, for his father's death... Ku stands. Starts walking toward them. Slowly. Inexorably. Riggs and Murtaugh watch as Ku approaches. They're alone. They're out of bullets. They're shot up, tired, and generally hurting...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Since I met you, I've done a lotta hairy shit, 'cause somebody had to back you up. But it ain't gonna happen now... I'm gonna be a grandfather, and you and Lorna are gonna have a baby... He ain't worth dying for, Riggs. The two men hold a long look. Beat. SIRENS APPROACH IN the DISTANCE.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. Cavalry's coming, anyway. And this guy won't get far. We can always track him down sometime when we have a howitzer... Your son-in-law's in there. Let's get him and get out. Murtaugh's not a little relieved. They turn, start off.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We're too old for this shit.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Guy's just too damn good.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah, he took my gun apart, for Christ's sake. How the hell'd he do that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah... How did he? They keep walking... Two more steps. Then stop. Look at each other. It's a long look. Murtaugh sighs...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, let's go ask him. They turn back. Start walking toward Ku. Ku keeps coming... The distance closes... Then, in English!-- «+ No tomorrow... And Riggs and Murtaugh charge... Ku knocks them both down... Then they're up. And the fight's on... What follows goes beyond what we've seen so far.
