Ku has the skill; Riggs and Murtaugh have the heart and the will Ku's methodical; they're animal, unstructured, spitting, tearing, howling. And taking massive punishment. When Ku's about to deliver the death blow to Murtaugh, Riggs intercedes. Murtaugh does the same for Riggs, barreling into Ku. Fighting the way a grizzly fights... The battle's nasty, brutish, and long. Murtaugh's beaten, a mess... In the end, it's up to Riggs. To reach deeper into himself than he already has. To become, despite age and attrition, something he once was. Insane. For all or zero... Twelve years melt away... This is the kid who jumped off buildings and killed Mr. Joshua. The demon-product of an idiotic war and dark memories and desperation... The Lethal Weapon... It's not that Riggs is, finally, better than Ku. He's just switched into a gear Ku isn't expecting. Taking punishment Ku and we would never think possible... Driving Ku back. Unleashing all his fury... when Murtaugh suddenly spears Ku with a piece of steel rebar. Front to back... Ku knocks Murtaugh unconscious for it... He'd kill Murtaugh next. If Riggs didn't grab the bar, a hand on either end, and whip Ku around... Riggs doesn't let go either. Grips the steel tight, uses it to maneuver Ku and inflict massive pain... when suddenly, Ku flicks his foot over his own shoulder and stuns Riggs. And the two men tumble off the pier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Ku sink to the bottom, still locked in battle, lit by the headlights of a car that Chu has driven off the pier after being shot dead trying to escape... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The odds shift back into Ku's favor again. He's nailed Riggs with the kick and now begins to punish him underwat not caring if he himself dies, as long as Riggs dies, too... when Riggs' hand finds an AK-47 inside the car with Chu. He pulls it out. Sticks it in Ku's belly... Ku tries to shove the barrel away... And Riggs OPENS UP on FULL AUTO. GUN flashes light silt-stirred water. Shell casings eject in SLO-MO through fluid resistance. And a magazine of AK SLUGS RIP UP Ku's guts... Blood fill the water. Ku's eyes meet Riggs'. Then his hand releases the gun barrel. And Ku drifts to the harbor floor... Riggs doesn't see him hit, though. He's heading topside for oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs breaks the surface. Gasping for air. He's won. To Ku, somewhere below him!--

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No tomorrow for you, asshole. He swims to a ladder fixed to a piling. Grabs a rung. Starts to hoist himself out... when Ku explodes up out of the water. Whips the garrote in his Buddhist prayer beads over Riggs' head and draws it tight. The wire bites into Riggs' neck. The weight of Ku's blood body pulls on him. Riggs white-knuckles the rung with one hand, tries to fight Ku off with the other... We see a ladder begin to pull away from the rotting wood and concrete of the pier... when Riggs finds the rebar still sticking through Ku's side and yanks it out... The searin pain causes Ku to loosen the garrote slightly. Enough for Riggs to get the rebar wedged inside it. To slide the rebar up alongside his face and begin to lever the garrot away from his neck... Slowly, he manages to slide the wir noose up over his head. And then, in a sudden reversal, whips the loop off his own head and back over Ku's... The ladder's hanging by a bolt now... Riggs tightens the garrote around Ku's neck... As the last bolt holding the ladder lets go, Riggs whips the garrote around a steel hook protruding from the ladder's side, and the ladder, still connected to a large chunk of concrete, drops into the depths, carrying Ku with it... He won't be coming back from that one... Whereupon Riggs reaches up for a piece of concrete and rebar hanging off the pier. Grabs it... And it breaks away on top of him. And Riggs, too, is gone. Plunged to the bottom... Not coming up. On the pier, Murtaugh comes to. Looks around. No one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs... He drags himself to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Riggs... Murtaugh moves to the dry dock. Small waves are still rebounding off the walls. But that's all. No bubbles. When the waves disappear, it's just still black water. Murtaugh screams now, looking down into the water.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Where are you, Riggs?! Nothing. Moving along the edge of the dry dock now, still calling down into the water --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Tell me where you are, Riggs!... Will it to me! Will it to me, Riggs!... Tell me where you are, Riggs!... Will it to me! Will it to me! Beat. Beat. Murtaugh's eyes suddenly swing to a spot in the water. Like he's heard something. He runs. A few strides along the edge. Then dives to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh swims down... Deeper and deeper... and... there, next to Ku's dead body and the ladder, is Riggs... Pinned under the large chunk of concrete and steel. Breath running out. Desperate eyes bugged, pleading with Murtaugh... It's hopeless for Murtaugh to try and shift such an enormous weight. Except that Murtaugh's gonna try. Gets his hands under the concrete. Plants his feet on the bottom of the dry dock. Lifts. Strains. Maxes every fiber in his body. Muscles burning from oxygen debt... until... the mass slowly begins to move ... More and more... And then Riggs is free. Murtaugh hauls his friend up toward the dim moonlight shimmering above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break the surface. Suck air and choke water. Alive. Barely. Murtaugh holding Riggs up so he can breathe. Tears in Murtaugh's eyes as he holds him...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I heard you, Riggs... I heard you... I heard you...  134 thru 150 151 134.

dialogues.speaker: UNUSED SCENE NUMBERS 134
dialogues.text: thru 150

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banged-up Riggs walks down a row of headstones until he finally stops. Kneels at a simple marker, just a name and dates: Victoria Lynn Riggs, 1953-1984. Brushing away some leaves!--

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I haven't been here enough. Riggs lays a hand on the stone. Closes his eyes... Re- living memories of the woman he'd loved and wed and buried... Stays that way a long time. Then opens his eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You already know I need to talk to you about Lorna... (beat) We're having a baby... You and I just never got the chance, did we?... (beat) «+. She wants to get married... And I love her, Vicki. I want to make her happy... But I keep seeing your face... (beat) I need your help. There's a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Leo appears, looking for something... when he sees Riggs, kneeling at the headstone. Leo stops. Suddenly uncomfortable. Realizing he's stumbled onto Riggs in a very private moment. Begins backing away. Steps on a TWIG. Riggs whirling around at the SNAPPING sound, gun in hand...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Leo. Jesus. You almost got yourself shot. And Leo, realizing he's intruded on something private!--

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to!-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I was tailing you... Practicing my P.I. stuff again... I'm sorry. I'll go. But he doesn't right away. Regarding the headstone! --

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Victoria Riggs... Your wife... She was killed...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Leo...

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Sorry, sorry. You want to be alone. I understand. Hey. I'm going, I'm going. Leo turns, starts off. Takes a few steps. Then stops. Turns back.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I had a pet frog when I was little...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Leo, please...

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Just gimme a sec, okay? Then I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (beat; if it'll get him outta there) Just make it fast.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, okay... So I had this frog. Named him Froggy. And I didn't really have friends, right, so Froggy was my friend... (a little embarrassed) -+. I used to kiss him. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There's a 136.

dialogues.speaker: LEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like in the fairy tales, the girl kisses the frog, and it turns into a prince? Since I was a boy, I figured maybe it'd turn into a princess. Then she could be my... I didn't have a mom growing up, y'know? She went, y'know, away or whatever. And dad was no Crackerjack prize... Anyway, Froggy didn't turn into anything, just stayed a frog, but was still my best friend, and one day I was carrying his box in my bike basket, and he jumped out. My back wheel ran over him. And he died... I was heartbroken... I'd never love another living thing ever again... Then, about a year later, the mentally slow guy in the next apartment, Iggy, his dog has puppies, and he has to get rid of 'em, and he asks me to take the one that didn't sell. So I do... Pretty soon, it's my new best friend. I named him Froggy the Second... It wasn't that he was a better pet. Just a different one... Anyway, I thought maybe it was relevant. long beat. After which, Leo turns, starts to go again. Then turns back...

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: When I was tailing you... You really didn't see me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: How about that? I tailed you, and you didn't see me. Riggs' BEEPER GOES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Who's that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (checks the number) The baby.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: The baby. Oh, shit, the baby. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Meet you at the cars. Leo goes. Riggs looks down at the headstone again. A long beat. He reaches into a pocket. Pulls out a gold wedding band. Looks at it a moment. Then, to Vicki!--

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'll always have this. Another beat. Then Riggs puts the ring back in his pocket. Stands. Heads off.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 152
dialogues.text: thru 162

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO NURSES are trying to wheel Lorna down the hall ona gurney, but Lorna keeps grabbing things, doors whatever she can to stop being moved.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I'm not going!

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Ma'am, please.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I'm not having the baby yet!

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: (trying to pry her loose) Ma'am, please...

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I'm L.A.P.D., girls. I'll arrest you for interfering with a cop. The Nurses get her loose. Whereupon Lorna grabs hold of an elderly patient wheeling an I.V. stand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Will you stop it? Riggs and Leo arrive.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's going on? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Riggs...

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: You're the husband?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Thank god.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You alright?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: No. I'm not alright. I lied, Riggs. I said I didn't need to get married. Well, I do. I need to get married. wife before I'm a mother --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: -- and I know you don't want to, but... You said okay?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: (to Nurse #2) He said okay.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: (to Leo) He said okay.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: What's that smell? Leo edges away from the elderly patient. back at Riggs. Meets his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: «+. Will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: -+.- You bet I will, Riggs. I need to be a Lorna looks (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: «+. Will you let go of the patient, now? Lorna lets go. To Riggs, as they roll on --

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Go get a minister.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: We're getting married.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We need blood tests. We need a license.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I don't care. I want to say the words. With a minister. Before the baby comes.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: You're gonna have it soon.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I'll have it when I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: You're about to pop, lady.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: (in her face) I'm getting married, or there's no baby! Got it?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: (to Riggs) This could be an aspect of the transition phase.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: This is not a goddamn aspect of the goddamn transition phase! They're entering a delivery toom. Lorna grabs the jambs.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Get a minister, Riggs. Now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leo takes 141.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Calm down, honey... Leo, find a minister, a priest, anything.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You're a detective. Just do it. Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Ten-four. off. Turning back to Lorna --

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We're getting a minister now. Let's go in the delivery room.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Not 'til I'm done saying 'I do.'

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: ... This wasn't even supposed to be my shift... Leo returns dragging a man wearing a yamulka.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon... (to Riggs and Lorna) This is Rabbi Gelb.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Rabbi? No offense, Rabbi.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: None taken.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You said 'anything.' No offense, Rabbi.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: None taken.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: He'll do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: For what? What's going on here? The Rabinowitz baby's waiting for his circumcision.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We want you to marry us, Rabbi.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: Marry you? Are you Jewish?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: Do you have a license?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No. See, Rabbi, she wants to feel married before the baby comes. To hear the words, y'know? It's important to her.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: ++. You're both serious about this? The Rabinowitz baby's schmeckel's getting cold, and I'm not wasting time on hijinks.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: We're serious. The Rabbi just looks at them a beat.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: She's a cop. Probably shoot you if you don't. Another beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be official.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: (beat; shrugs) What the hell. What're your names?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'm Martin, she's Lorna. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Riggs and 143.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: Martin and Lorna. Let's see, how do you goyim do it?... Dearly beloved. Marriage is the spiritual bonding of two people, intended by God for --

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Fast forward, Rabbi. Baby's in the home stretch.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: (speeds up) Will you, Martin, take Lorna to be your wife? Will you love her, comfort her, honor and keep her, in sickness and in health; and, forsaking all others, be faithful to her as long as you're both alive?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: Lorna, will you have Martin to be your husband? Will you love, comfort, honor and keep him, in sickness and in health; and forsaking all others be faithful, etc.?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: RABBI GELB
dialogues.text: I now pronounce you husband and wife. Pending the formalities... You may kiss the bride. Lorna kiss. Then she turns to the nurse --

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Okay, let's get this done.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Wait, you gotta break a glass. He looks around, sees an old gent in patient's garb walking by with a glass specimen jar. Leo grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I need this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Hey... Leo pours it out into a nearby drinking fountain.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: It took me all day to do that. Having rinsed the jar, Leo brings it over, puts it on the ground by Riggs, and puts his hat over it.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Now step on it. Riggs does. Breaks the glass.

dialogues.speaker: LEO/RABBI
dialogues.text: Mazeltov! Lorna's in. Riggs follows. So does Leo. Riggs stops him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Out, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of babies in isolettes positioned near the viewing window. The CAMERA looking out as Riggs and Leo appear at the window. Riggs showing Leo the new arrival. Knocks on the window to get the attention of the NURSERY NURSE. Holds up his badge. The Nurse nods, moves to an islolette containing a swaddled baby, its head obscured by the blanket. She wheels the isolette to the window. Unwraps the blanket, revealing... A BLACK BABY GIRL. Double-takes all around... when there's a tap on Riggs' shoulder, and he turns to see Butters and Murtaugh. Butters holding up his badge for the nurse. And now everybody's starting to understand the mix-up. The nurse goes to get another isolette as we WATCH BUT CAN'T HEAR Riggs, Butters, Murtaugh, and Leo. It's clear Rianne's just had her baby, too. Congratulations all around. Then the nurse wheels up the second isolette, pulls back the blanket... and reveals RIGGS BABY BOY. OFF the men, looking in, making faces at the kids --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo's trying to buy a throw-away camera from a camera vending machine. The machine keeps rejecting his rumpled dollar bills. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Two families with babies, and nobody thinks to bring a camera? REVEAL Riggs, Lorna, and their baby, and Murtaugh, Trish, Nick, Carrie, Butters, Rianne, and their baby. Lorna and Rianne are in wheelchairs.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: C'mon, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, hurry up, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I'm hurrying. The machine rejects another bill.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Argh... You got one little wrinkle in a dollar... I hate machines. Know why? Okay. Because machines always fu --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH/RIGGS
dialogues.text: Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, whatever, whatever... Captain Murphy enters carrying two presents.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Hey, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Came to offer my congratulations. He takes the presents to Rianne and Lorna.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Little something from the squad.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Anything for us?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Matter of fact, yeah. He takes two badges out of his jacket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Gimme those Captain badges back. You're sergeants again.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What about the insurance?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: City's decided to self-insure. We're spared having you in command any longer. (to Murtaugh) By the way, you owe the Chief one. Went to bat for you with the I.N.S. They're granting asylum to that Chinese family. Leo finally has the camera.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I got it. Everybody move in close... Make sure the flash is working... As they all tighten up for the shot, and Leo figures out the flash, Rianne and Butters exchange a loving look. She hands him their daughter to hold. Butters looks at the baby a moment. Then looks at Murtaugh standing next to him. Extends the baby to Murtaugh. Murtaugh looks at Butters. The cop who took his daughter. The one thing Murtaugh didn't want. Reach- ing out to Murtaugh. Offering the baby, but asking for something more. Acceptance... It's a yes... Murtaugh takes the bundle from Butters. Cradles his granddaughter.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Today, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I got, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Get in here, Captain. Murphy moves to join the group. Leo tries to get everybody in frame.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Don't cut any heads off.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah, back up, Leo. Make sure you get everybody in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leo backs up.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Back, back...

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERS
dialogues.text: Back...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Back... Whereupon Leo's backed through a set of automatic hospital doors, which now slam in his face.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Argh... The doors re-open.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I coulda put out my goddamn eye. He hands the camera to a passing HOSPITAL EMPLOYEE.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Here. You take the picture. Leo moves over to join the group. The Hospital Employee looks them over, directing them --

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Closer... Move in on this side... (checks viewfinder) That's great. (then, looking up) You're all friends?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We're all family. The Hospital Employee aims the camera.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Okay. On three. At which Riggs and Murtaugh exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: One... two... three... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FLASH. And WE FREEZE... On twelve faces that will smile those smiles on their family picture shelves forever... A dozen people we've grown to love. People we hate to say goodbye to... But it's that time... And so, off them, all together, frozen in time, we... FADE OUT.
